She pledges to make her repayments in a punctual manner. She will use the loan to buy cookies, caramels, chocolates, chewing gum, puffed cheese snacks, lollipops, and other sweets so she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy cookies, caramels, chocolates, chewing gum, etc.

loans.name: Flor De Cardamomo Campamac Group

texts.es:
El señor Domingo es casado, tiene 46 años de edad, no le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar ya que tenia que ayudar a sus padres con el trabajo, tiene 5 hijos y 4 de ellos estan estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de cardamomo, inició este negocio desde niño ayudando a sus padres y hasta la fecha lleva 35 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la limpieza de cardamomo, desea en el futuro proximo tener mas terreno para sembrar cardamomo. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de cardamomo y mania. En la fotografia aparecen 19 integrantes pero, solamente a 18 de ellos se le concedio el préstamo.
texts.en:
Domingo is married and is 46 years old.  He was not given the opportunity to go to school, because he had to help his parents with their work.  He has 5 children, 4 of whom attend school.  He is a farmer who grows cardamom.  He started in this line of work when he was a child helping his parents, and so he now has 35 years of experience.

He is organizing a group and requesting a loan that he will use to clear his cardamom fields.  In the future, he wants to have more land to grow cardamom.  The other members of this group grow cardamom and peanuts.  In the photograph 19 members appear, but only 18 of them will be taking this loan.

loans.use: to clear his cardamom fields

loans.name: Paz

texts.es: Doña Paz de 66 años de edad es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en casa propia con su sobrino de 20 años de edad el estudia actualmente, hace varios años posee su propia tienda, con las ganancias de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Paz solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para su tienda como: granos básicos, azúcar, sopas, refrescos, golosinas, etc. con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Paz is 66 years old. She is an enterprising and hardworking person. She lives in her own house with her 20-year-old nephew, who is currently in school. 

For some years, she has had her own store. With the earnings from her business she has been able to pay off some household debts. 

Paz is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for her store, such as: basic grains, sugar, soup, soft drinks, candy, etc. With this loan, she hopes to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, sugar, soup, soft drinks, candy, etc.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou homme de 40ans vit avec sa famille(femme et 04 enfants) à Lomé. Il est électricien auto et en même temps revendeur de batteries. Aidé par 02 personnes, il sollicite son troisième prêt à WAGES pour acheter des batteries. Il espère épargner et subvenir aux besoins de la famille grâce aux profits.
texts.en: Kokou is 40 years old and he lives with his family (his wife and four children) in Lomé.  He works as an auto-electrician and also resells batteries.  Two persons help him run his business.  He is requesting a third loan from WAGES to buy some car batteries.  He hopes that the profits from this loan will help him to save some money and meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy car batteries for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and widowed. She is blessed with five children and runs a small hotel (primitive restaurant) business in Nairobi. She has been in this business for two and a half years and makes a monthly income of 7,000 Kenya Shillings. 

She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of foodstuffs such as rice, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat. She also plans to buy utensils for use in the hotel. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children, repay her loan and expand her business. 

This is her first loan with KADET LTD., and she hopes to stabilize her business and improve her standards of living by building her own residential home.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, rice, sugar and utensils for use in the hotel.

loans.name: Lipena

texts.en:
Lipena is 48 years old and married, with three children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Lepena has requested a loan to buy a gas oven, gas, a frying pan, dripping oil, sugar and flour. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. 

Lipena will use her earnings to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and equipment

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en: Lagi is 73 years old, widowed, with eight children. She plans to start a business selling tinned food snacks, soap, and much more. She has requested a loan to buy chicken, corned beef, telephone cards, sugar, salt, noodles, milk and laundry soap. Lagi will use her profits to extend her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2007

loans.use: to buy chicken, corned beef, telephone cards, sugar, salt, noodles, milk and laundry soap

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Doña concepción de 61 años de edad, es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a su trabajo, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, hace 5 años se dedica a la agricultura y adicional a eso vende  frutas y verduras  de forma ambulantes, con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña concepción solicita un crédito para compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plaga, etc.  con esto espera  brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Concepción is 61 years old. She is a very responsible person who is dedicated to her work. She lives in her own house with her life partner and her two children. She has been working in agriculture for the past 5 years. In addition to this, she sells fruits and vegetables as a street vendor. With the income from her business, she is able to pay for some of the expenses of her household. Concepción is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as manure, fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides, etc. With this she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 37 years old and a single mother of one child. She supports three family members. She has a grocery shop and has been in this business for 10 years. She currently gets a monthly income of 8,500 Kenya Shillings. 

She will use the loan to purchase more vegetables and cereals for her shop. This will enable her to have enough stock to meet the demands of her customers. She will use the generated profits to pay for her son’s school fees and feed her family. 

This is her first loan with KADET LTD., and her dream is to have a happy family.

loans.use: To add stock of vegetables and cereals.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 25 years old and married but has no children. Her husband provides additional income, which she uses to support her two siblings. She runs a mobile money transfer business (M-pesa) shop, which gives her a monthly income of 6,000 Kenya Shillings. She also has a photocopying business.

Teresa has been in this business for four years and will use the loan to add more money float to her business. This is her first loan with KADET LTD., and she hopes to use her profits to open other mobile money transfer shops. 

Her dreams are to become financially stable, have a large business and grant job opportunities to the youth.

loans.use: To support her mobile money transfer business by adding more money float.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est âgée de 41ans.Elle a pour conjoint un déclarant en douane avec 04 enfants en charge. L'ainé a 14ans et le dernier 04ans. Ils sont tous scolarisés. Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, elle a commencé par vendre des ustensiles de cuisine et des habits à domicile depuis 2003.  Madame Akouvi espère à l'avenir élargir sa boutique et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille. Elle sollicite un premier prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises.
texts.en:
Akouvi is 41 years old. Her spouse is a customs officer and she has four children to care for. The eldest is 14 years old and the youngest is four. They are all in school. 

To contribute to the needs of her family, she started selling kitchen utensils and clothes from her home since 2003. Mrs. Akouvi hopes in the future to expand her shop and improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a first loan to buy more goods.

loans.use: buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is 35 years of age and a single mother of two children aged 13 and 11 years. She owns a boutique, a business she started 10 years ago, and earns a monthly income of 40,000 KES. 

Florah wants to restock her business and has requested a seventh loan of 70,000 KES to purchase more clothes, shoes and handbags to sell. The profit from her business will help her pay school fees for her children. 

Her dream is to one day own a vehicle and have rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, shoes and handbags to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 16 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past three years, Josephine has been working hard to manage her fishing business. 

To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fish, and will help Josephine to generate greater profits and Increase her sales. Josephine hopes that in the future she will be able to start purchasing tomatoes for sale. 

Josephine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Nzokira Group

texts.fr:
Adelaïde fait partie du groupe  Nzokira et  habite à Gitega. C’est une veuve de 52 ans. Elle a 2 enfants  âgés de 15 à 18 ans, dont 1 étudie. 

Elle fait le commerce de pommes de terre   depuis 8 ans. 

Elle est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de kilos de pommes de terre à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait  voir son enfant continuer les études.
texts.en:
Adelaide is part of the Nzokira group and lives in Gitega. She is a widow of 52 years. She has two children aged 15 and 18, including one who is studying.

She has been trading potatoes for the past eight years.

She is on her eighth credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she will increase her working capital and buy many kilos of potatoes for resale, to earn more.

In coming years she wants to see her child continue school.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy many kilos of potatoes for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de condiments depuis 1992, Afi s'approvisionne à Lomé et revend sous un hangard. Mariée, elle a 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés. Elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter des condiments afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Le rêve de madame Afi est d'avoir une boutique et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
A retailer of condiments since 1992, Afi buys and sells in Lome under a shed. She is married and has four children of whom three attend school.

She is requesting her first loan to buy condiments, to better meet customer needs.

Mrs. Afi's dream is to own a shop and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Luisa María

texts.es: Luisa, a sus 21 años es soltera y está en estado de embarazo. Actualmente se dedica a trabajar como auxiliar de enfermería en una clínica del municipio donde reside; además alterna su empleo con la actividad agropecuaria, pues se dedica a la comercialización de pollos y huevos, ya que posee varias gallinas ponedoras en un pequeño galpón; esta actividad la aprendió de su madre y lleva aproximadamente 5 años realizándola. De esta manera obtiene los ingresos suficientes para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. La cliente es una joven activa, dinámica, emprendedora y pujante, diariamente se esfuerza para conseguir todo lo necesario para brindar a su hijo la posibilidad de nacer y crecer en un hogar, con buena condición económica. Esto la motiva a solicitar el crédito, que será invertido en la compra de 70 gallinas ponedoras a $25.000 cada una y además realizará adecuaciones para ampliar el galpón, con esto espera poder producir más huevos para la venta y aumentar los ingresos, con los cuales podrá mejorar la economía en su hogar y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Luisa is 21 years old, single, and is pregnant. She currently works as a nursing assistant in a municipal clinic in the town where she lives. She also works in agriculture by selling chickens and eggs, because she has several egg-laying chickens in a small chicken house. She learned this business from her mother and has been doing it for approximately 5 years. This is how she earns enough income to cover the basic necessities of her household. She is active, dynamic, entrepreneurial, and thriving. She works hard every day to get everything she needs to provide her child with the opportunity to be born into and raised in a home with a good economic situation. This is what motivates her to request the loan, which she will invest in buying 70 egg-laying hens at $25.00 each. She will also improve and expand her chicken house. With this she hopes to be able to produce more eggs for sale and increase her income, which would improve the economic situation of her household and the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy 70 egg-laying hens at $25.00 each and also to improve and expand her chicken house

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: jacqueline est une jeune femme de 35 ans célibataire, mère d'un enfant agé de 16 ans  qui va à l'école, elle a aussi 2 autres personnes à sa charge. elle est commerçante depuis 20 ans déjà dans un marché de la place ou elle commercialise le couscous (manioc et maïs) la tomate selon les saisons. elle a de l'expérience en la matière et se debrouille assez bien. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour se déplacer et allez acheter sa marchandise à des prix bas et en grande quantité dans les villages. Ce qui lui permettra d'agrandir son activité et surtout de réaliser un bon bénéfice. profit qui l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et d'épargner pour les besoins futurs comme la scolarité.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a young 35-year-old woman, the single mother of a 16-year-old child who goes to school. She also has two other dependents.

She has been a retail merchant for the past 20 years in a local market where she sells couscous (of cassava or corn) and tomatoes depending on the seasons. She is experienced in this area of activity which she manages pretty well.

She is requesting this loan so she can travel and go buy her goods in the villages at low prices and in large quantities . This will allow her to expand her business and especially to make good profits. In turn, this will help her meet her family's needs and save for future needs such as education.

loans.use: to travel through the countryside (to buy food products)

loans.name: Sebastienne Eugenie

texts.fr: Sebastienne est une jeune femme de 32 ans,fiancée et mère de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 06 et 16 ans.elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 11 ans où elle vend du piment.La petitesse de son capital l'oblige souvent à acheter deux ou trois  filets de piments pour détailler ce qui crée souvent des ruptures de stock et l'empêche de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle qui est de plus en plus grandissante car elle est obligé d'écouler tout le stock avant de pouvoir le renouveller et d'avoir un bénéfice considérable.Elle sollicite donc ce crédit pour pouvoir acheter plus de filets(10) ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire sa clientèle, d'augmenter ses ventes et par conséquent son bénéfice.Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité et économisera l'autre pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Sebastienne is a young woman, 32 years old, engaged to be married, and the mother of three children, from 6 to 16 years old. She has been a merchant at a local market for eleven years. Her meager capital often compels her to purchase two or three bags of chili peppers retail. Having to sell her entire inventory before being able to renew it, she often has inventory shortages which prevent her from satisfying her burgeoning customer base appropriately and from making a significant profit. So she is requesting this loan to purchase more bags (10) of chili peppers enabling her to satisfy her customer and to increase her sales and thus her profits. She will reinvest part of her profits in her business and will save the other part for her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy chili peppers

loans.name: Wilfried

texts.fr: Pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, monsieur Wilfried fait sa toute première demande à WAGES. Revendeur de produits d'alimentation générale(tomate en boite, sucre, lait,riz...), mr Wilfried s'approvisionne généralement à Lomé et revend à domicile. Son souhait est d'avoir un terrain pour construire et aussi améliorer le bien - être de la famille. Notons qu'il est marié avec 02 enfants de 3ans, 08 mois en charge. Mr Wilfried a une ancienneté d'01an envoisinne les 33ans.
texts.en:
To better meet the needs of his customers, Mr. Wilfried is making his very first request from WAGES. A retailer of general food products (canned tomatoes, sugar, milk, rice ...), Mr. Wilfried generally resupplies in Lome and resells at home. 

His wish is to have a plot of land where he can build and also improve his family's well-being.

Note that he is married with two children to care for, three years and 8 months old. Mr Wilfried has one year seniority and is about 33 years old.

loans.use: Buy general food products

loans.name: Kreiver

texts.es: Kreiver, de 52 años de edad, está casado con Dora y tiene 03 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Kreiver se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi el cual se compró con el fruto de sus ahorros. Realiza esta función circulando por las principales calles de la ciudad en la que vive. Se inició hace 15 años cuando se compró su primera unidad, en el transcurso del tiempo fue renovando otras unidades a medida que iban deteriorándose por el uso cotidiano. Se inició por la necesidad de contar con un trabajo ya que no podía conseguir un empleo, ahora se siente con mayor seguridad pues puede manejar sus horarios, además de ser su propio jefe. Por lo contrario comenta que no le gusta cuando su mototaxi se malogra o sufre algunos daños de manera continúa pues le ocasiona muchos gastos, pero aun así logra ver buenos resultados, por eso tiene planes de hacer crecer su actividad de transporte y espera comprarse otro vehículo para alquilarlo y asegurar su economía. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para poder alcanzar sus objetivos.Con el monto solicitado comprará repuestos para su mototaxi y algunos accesorios para que funcione en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Kreiver is 52 years old. He is married to Dora and has 3 children, with whom they live in their own home. Kreiver works transporting passengers in his mototaxi, which he purchased with his savings. He does this work driving through the main streets in the city where he lives. 

He started 15 years ago when he bought his first vehicle; over time, he renovated other vehicles as they deteriorated from daily use. He began because he needed steady work, since he wasn’t able to find a job. Now, he feels more secure because he can make his own hours, in addition to being his own boss. 

On the other hand, he says that he doesn’t like when his mototaxi breaks down or gets damaged over and over, because it costs him a lot of money. Even so, he has achieved good results; therefore, he has plans to expand his transportation business, and he hopes to buy another vehicle to rent out and secure his finances. 

With this opportunity, he will request S/. 2000. He feels grateful for the financial support that he is receiving in order to reach his goals. With the requested loan, he will purchase parts for his mototaxi and some accessories so that it runs under optimal conditions.

loans.use: to purchase parts and accessories for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Djatougbé

texts.fr: Djatougbé sollicite son second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des perles et des produits divers. Activité qu'elle mène depuis 1997 de façon ambulante. Elle est mère de 06 enfants et a pour mari un cultivateur. Âgée de 58ans, madame Djatougbé souhaite agrandir la taille de son activité et assurer une bonne condition de vie à la famille.
texts.en:
Djatougbé is requesting her second credit loan from WAGES to buy beads and various products. She has been leading this itinerant activity since 1997.

She is the mother of six children and her husband is a farmer. Mrs. Djatougbé is 58 years old and wants to expand the size of her business activity and provide good living conditions for the family.

loans.use: Buy beads and various products

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne is a 41-year-old married woman  from Bien Unido, Bohol and the mother of three children. She has been engaged in the fishing business  together with her husband for more than nine years now. This is their main source of income. Yvonne is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is married and she works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Aurelia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan in order to build and expand her general store business.

Aurelia has been in this business for 14 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Aurelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: A rural farmer from Takeo province, Heang is the breadwinner in her family consisting of nine children.  For her, animal husbandry (raising chickens and ducks) and rice farming are the primary sources of her family's income. This business has returned her up to USD 8 per day to support her living. Heang is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she has to care for only one son who is studying at a local university specializing in English literature. To cover her son's tuition fee, she decided to take her first loan from VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She hopes that her son can focus on his study and get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s tuition

loans.name: Chikanga Stars Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 47-year-old Letwin from Mutare. She is widowed with three children. She also cares for one other dependent. 

Letwin runs a retail business selling clothes, and she is a member of the Chikanga Stars group. The business has been in operation for seven years. She says the main challenges faced are high import duties at border posts and stiff competition. 

Letwin has requested a loan of $600 to buy clothes for resale in town. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to expand her business and improve her family's general welfare. In the future, Letwin plans to operate a boutique shop in town.

loans.use: to buy clothes from Mozambique and South Africa for resale.

loans.name: Taumainuumau

texts.en: Taumainuumau is 65 years old and a widow with six children. She runs a small business selling cabbages, tomatoes, oranges, ripe bananas, pawpaw, and pineapples in her community and has been doing this for 10 years. Taumainuumau has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, a garden fork, a rake and a garden hose. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Taumainuumau will support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, a garden fork, a rake and a garden hose

loans.name: Gafua

texts.en: Gafua is a 42-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, banana and breadfruit to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Gafua has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer and barbed wire. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Gafua hopes to sell to bigger businesses that will export her product, especially taro. With her profits, she will save more for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer and barbed wire

loans.name: Marselina

texts.en:
Marselina is a 55-year-old woman who is married to Daniel, a 55-year-old man. They have been blessed with four sons: Victor, a 30-year-old policeman; Frangky, a 25-year-old entrepreneur; James, a 23-year-old college student; and Mario, a 20-year-old who graduated from high school.

Marselina initiated a pig-breeding business in 2009. Nowadays, she has three pigs. These pigs bear three times a year, and commonly a pig brings forth 10-12 piglets per birthing. Usually she sells the piglets in the amount of 750,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiah) each. The income from the business enables her to support the needs of her family, as her husband has gone through an early retirement because of sickness. 

At the moment, Marselina desires to raise more piglets, which means that she needs more stock of fodder. Her lack of money has led her to ask for an individual loan from TLM in amount of 10,000,000 IDR. The loan will be spent on the fodder, and to pay her son's school fee. She hopes that the loan will help her to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fodder and pay her son's school fee.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 39-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has seven children. The oldest is 20, while the youngest is 5. She does farming. She grows and sells rice. Her husband is a farmer. They help one another to raise their family. She has been growing rice for more than 10 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fertilizers and medicines to improve her harvest. In the future, Gina hopes that she could manage well her farming livelihood, and could send all her children to school and also provide them with a proper diet.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and medicines.

loans.name: El Escondite Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento EL ESCONDITE,  Está  compuesto por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un varon,   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Angelina  tiene 32 años casad con dos hijos de 7 y 9 años, ella se dedica a  servicio costura de polleras para las cholitas, en su taller propio que se encuentran en su mismo domicilio en la zona de Chimboco , este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Angelina  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de tela e hilo para la confección de sus polleras,    la Sra. Angelina  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de maquinas  y a veces de material cuando le hacen pedidos por mayor depende de los trabajos que tiene que realizar y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de tela, la Sra. Angelina  es una persona trabajadora que su deseo es tener un taller grande y contratar mano de obra y así enseñar a jóvenes el oficio de la confección.
texts.en:
The entrepreneur bank El Escondite is made up of nine members: eight women and one man.

The president of the bank is Angelina, who is 32 years old and married, with two children, seven and nine years old. She makes her living sewing skirts for women in her own workshop. Her workshop is located in her house, in the Chimboco zone. 

This loan is her first sequence within the institution. Angelina will use the loan to purchase fabric and yarn for making her skirts. 

Angelina faces challenges with her business, which are a lack of materials and sometimes of material when wholesale orders are made, depending on the work she has to do. She will use the profits to buy fabric. 

Angelina is a hardworking person. Her wish is to have a big workshop and hire labor, thus teaching young people craft of tailoring.

loans.use: to buy materials (fabric).

loans.name: Basri

texts.en: Basri is 37 years old, married and a father of two children who are three and six years old. Based on tradition, he works in agriculture. He is a very hard worker who does a lot in order to earn a living.  He has a greenhouse where he plants and grows vegetables to use for for his family. He also owns land in the mountain, where he has trees to sell as wood for heating during the winter time. In addition, he owned a cow, but recently had to sell it as he was in need of the money for his family. It is in these ways that he attempts to earn enough money to provide for his family’s basic needs. Now for the first time, he is requesting a loan in order to buy another cow. The loan will help him to reduce the costs of milk and milk products for his family and potentially sell some as well. He is hoping in the near future to add more cows. His goal is to offer a better life to his family. He appreciates all lenders for this help!

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Merushe

texts.en:
Merushe is 47 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a small village in the southern part of Kosovo. To earn a living, her husband works as a construction worker for a private company earning a small income for their family. For quite some time now, Merushe has owned a cow. She sells the cow milk in her neighborhood. She earns 140 Euros per month by selling the milk.
 
Her stable is very old. For the first time, she is requesting a loan in order to renovate the stable and buy another cow. The loan will help her to expand and develop her business and she hopes that another cow will help her to increase her income. Her goal is to sell milk and milk products so that she can improve the living conditions for her family and provide a better quality of life and opportunities for her children. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To renovate her stable and buy another cow

loans.name: Isaac

texts.fr: Isaac est un jeune homme de 30ans et père d'un enfant. il s'est installé à son propre compte en optant pour la vente des oignons dans un marché de la place.compte tenu de la petitesse de son capital,il est contamment confronté à un problème de rupture de stock  par conséquent n'arrive pas à satisfaire sa clientèle.raison pour laquelle il sollicite un crédit acheter les oignons en grande quantité. ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire la clientèle. les bénéfices qui en résulteront lui permettront d'accroitre son activité et en plus il aimerait améliorer les conditions de vie de sa petite famille et envoyer son enfant à l'école.
texts.en:
Isaac is a young man of 30 years, father of one child. He set up his own business, opting to sell onions in a local market. Given the small size of his working capital, he is continually facing a shortage problem, and therefore can not satisfy his customers.

For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy onions in large quantities. thus allowing him to satisfy his customers. The resulting profits will enable him to expand his activity.

Additionally, he would like to improve his small family's living conditions and send his child to school.

loans.use: buy large quantities of onions

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry earns a living through her pot-making business .She lives with her family in the town of Dauis, Bohol. Cherry has been in the business for more than 20 years now. Cherry is asking for a loan to buy materials for making pots like cement, sand, and paints. With this, she will be able to make more pots and other earthenware to sell in the market. Cherry hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for making pots like cement, sand, and paint

loans.name: Gilbert Gele

texts.fr: Gilbert est un jeune homme de 24 ans. pour s'installer à son compte, il a pu mettre en place une petite alimentation dans un quartier de la place.mais au regard de sa clientèle grandissante il se trouve confronté à un problème constant de manque de pproduits de première nécessité. raison pour laquelle il sollicite un crédit pour diversifier sa marchandise afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. en plus,les bénéfices qui en résulteront lui permettront de réinvestir et à satisfaire ses besoins vitaux.
texts.en:
Gilbert is a young 24-year-old man. To establish his own business, he was able to set up a small grocery store in a local neighborhood.  Given his growing customer base, he faces a constant shortage problem regarding basic necessities.

For this reason he is requesting a loan to diversify his merchandise in order to meet customer demand.

Additionally, the resulting profits will be reinvested and help meet his basic needs.

loans.use: diversify products for sale

loans.name: Fibetado Group

texts.fr: Le groupement FIBETADO est composé de dix neuf personnes qui sont des amies et résident dans le même village. La représente du groupe, nommée Adidjatou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 30 ans. Adidjatou n’a pas  fréquenté l’école. Adidjatou est mariée un cultivateur du nom de Sègbégnon. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolariés et tous à leur charge. Adidjatou vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de famille sont assurées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Adidjatou mène comme activité la vente de maïs et du haricot depuis six dans sa région.  En plus de son activité principale, dame Adidjatou vend aussi du gari(farine de manioc). Adidjatou s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’accroitre le niveau de son activité Adidjatou ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement FIBETADO sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Fibetado group consists of nineteen people who are friends and live in the same village. The person representing the group is named Adidjatou (the one with the hand raised on the photo). She is 30 years old.

Adidjatou did not attend school. She married a farmer named Sègbégnon. The couple has four children, all attending school and all under their care. Adidjatou lives with her ​​husband and children, and the various family expenditures are handled by the couple.

To achieve this, Adidjatou has been running a business selling corn and beans throughout the region since she was six. In addition to her core business lady Adidjatou also sells gari (cassava flour). She resupplies in one of Benin's markets.

To increase the level of their activity, Adidjatou and the other members of the Fibetado group are requesting a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: buy corn, beans and gari (cassava flour)

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 34 years of age, married and blessed with a 4-year-old child. He provides transport services with his motorbike, a business he started five years ago and has steadily expanded with a monthly income of 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

He has requested a third loan of 70,000 KES to purchase another motorbike. The profit he earns will aid him to educate his child, which is also his dream.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike.

loans.name: Fatheya

texts.en:
Fatheya was born in 1964. She is married and has five children. Her husband works as a bus driver, which is a weak source of income that is not letting him be able to cover his children's needs by himself. 

Fatheya started working in sewing 10 years ago to help her husband to earn better income. She started her project with one sewing machine. Then she had the chance to open her own sewing workshop. Now she needs a loan to buy more sewing machines for her new workshop to be able to run her business perfectly.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old and married to Peter with whom she supports a family of seven people. She runs two businesses; selling clothing as well as a small scale dairy farm in Tachasis. She has been in these businesses for the last twelve years and gets a monthly profit of KES 18,000.
 
ELizabeth has borrowed a third loan of KES 100,000 from KADET Ltd after successfully paying back her previous loans. With this loan she plans to use some of the amount borrowed to purchase new clothes to sell in her shop and the remaining amount she will use to purchase dairy feed, deworming drugs, salt licks and vitamin supplements for her cows. 

Elizabeth anticipates getting profits which she will use to improve her businesses as well as purchase more dairy cows. Her dreams and hopes are to expand her business and possibly open a supermarket in her town, and also expand her dairy farm.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell and feed for her dairy cows

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma lives in the littoral city of Batumi. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband, retired father-in-law and three school-age children. Irma is unemployed at the moment. The only source of income for the family is the monthly salary earned by Irma’s husband working as a truck driver locally. He works hard all day long to generate an income but the family needs more and Irma decided to start a fast food café to earn additional income. 

Several times, she has requested loans from local credit providers, but her loan requests are always rejected because of the lack of experience in her new business. Her current loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. With the startup credit, Irma will set up a fast food café. She will purchase all the needed inventory and renovate her own commercial space to start business there. She will sell sandwiches, pies, and fizzy drinks. Summertime is high season in Batumi and the city is full of holiday makers. Irma hopes her business will be profitable and that she will attract many customers since there is no similar café nearby.  The profit will be reinvested in the same business and Irma will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and renovate commercial space to start a cafe

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married lady who is 51 years old and has no children.  She owns a food cafe in Marigat town and has been in the business for over eight years, earning an income of KES 30,000 monthly.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 115,000 from KADET LTD as her fourth loan and intends to purchase sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour, and maize meal among other stock to continue her business. The profits she earns will be used to expand the wholesale and retail shop that she owns.

Her dream is to encounter prosperity in her businesses and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour, maize meal, etc. for her cafe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Albanus

texts.en:
Albanus, who is 52 years old and married, runs a hotel business in Makueni town. He has been in this business for five years and it has been profitable. 

This is his second loan term and he plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of food items for use in his hotel business. These include maize flour, sugar, milk and wheat flour. This will enable him to meet his customer's demands and thereby generate more profits with which he will use to pay school fees for his children.

In future, he hopes to grow his hotel business and be successful and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize flour, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 26 years old. She is married with one child aged two. She sells different items in her boutique and has been in the business for the past six years. She has requested the loan to buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same existing retail business.

Yvonne is very thankful for the previous loan that helped her to upgrade her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has a tailoring business in Nairobi. She is 52 years old and a single mother of one child. She has been in this business for 15 years and currently makes a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

Having paid her previous loan successfully, this will be Lucy's second loan with KADET LTD. She will use the loan to purchase more fabrics and sewing machines. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business by buying more sewing materials. 

Lucy hopes to provide the best education for her child and be successful in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and sewing machines.

loans.name: Diana's Group

texts.en:
Diana's group comprises four hardworking women. Diana is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past four years, Diana has been working hard to manage her salon. 

To help expand her business, Diana has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase another hair dryer for the salon, and this will help Diana to generate greater profits. Diana hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another branch. 

Diana is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase another hair dryer for the salon.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Mario sigue con la misma actividad el es agricultor desde hace ya bastante tiempo, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la siembra de Maíz, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas para la siembra de maíz y también para el preparado de la tierra, se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que está creciendo y mejorando su actividad.
texts.en: Mario has worked as a farmer for some time now.  He says that all went well with his previous loan which he used for cultivating corn.  This time, he is seeking a loan to buy seeds for cultivating corn and also to prepare is land.  He is happy and grateful for the opportunity he has been given because his business is growing and improving.

loans.use: to buy seeds for cultivating corn and to prepare his land

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Jose se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Derecho.
Por iniciativa propia, Jose trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta y alquiler de trajes de danzas, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación.
Jose se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de vestimenta para su negocio, así pues Jose seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Jose is a single man of 21 who lives in the city of Nazca with his parents and brothers.  He is a very cheerful, hardworking and enthusiastic person who, through his own effort and the help of his parents, is determined to succeed.  Jose is currently studying Law.  On his own initiative, he set up a small shop selling and hiring out dance costumes. He works for about 8 hours each day and believes that his success is down to his dedication.  Jose is very grateful to Kiva lenders because their help will enable him to buy a greater quantity and range of costumes for his shop.  This will mean that he can continue working and striving to achieve his dream of owning his own home.

loans.use: to buy new dance costumes

loans.name: Mamadou Demba

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou est un vendeur de bétail qui habite à 12km du Guichet. Agé de 58 ans il est marié et père de 3 enfants sont le plus grand à20ans et le plus petit 16ans. Il pratique cet activité de plus de 18ans. Il gère les charges de sa famille et celles de ses enfants. Mamadou commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Mamadou demande un crédit d'un montant de 150.000F pour augmenter son cheptel et satisfaire sa clientèle. Ses projets futurs sont l'ouverture d'une ferme agricole et la diversification de son cheptel.
texts.en:
Mamadou is a livestock trader who lives twelve kilometres from the loan office. He is 58 years old, married and the father of three children - the eldest of whom is 20 and the youngest 16 years old. He covers the expenses of his family and also those of his children. 
Mamadou begins his day at 8am and finishes at 6pm. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 150,000F in order to increase his livestock and meet his customers' demand.
His plans for the future are to start an agricultural farm and to diversify his livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for future resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish concreting her house

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Rose est une femme de 44 ans mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. pour s'installer à son propre compte ,elle à opté offrir les services de communication par téléphone communément appélés call box.compte tenu de la peititesse de son capital,elle est toujours confrontée à un problème de rupture de stocks de crédit de communication. raison pour laquelle Rose sollicite un crédit pour acheter plus de crédits de communication et des cartes de crédits afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un peu plus de bénéfices. lesquels lui permettront à la longue de diversifier son activité et d'avoir une vie stable.
texts.en:
Rose is a 44 year old mother of one child, who attends school. In order to set up her own business, she has decided to offer the telephone communication services that are commonly known as 'Call Box'. Considering the small size of her working capital, she is always confronted with running out of stock of communication credit. This is why Rose is requesting a loan, in order to purchase more credit and phone cards - this will allow her to better satisfy her customers and to make a little more profit.
In the long run, this will allow her to diversify her business, and to have a stable life.

loans.use: to purchase additional telecom credit and phone credit cards.

loans.name: Mamantou

texts.fr: Née en 1970, ayant pour profession une cultivatrice, Mamantou vit à KABOLI(une localité située en RÉGION CENTRALE du TOGO). Mariée à un enseignant, elle a en charge 05 enfants tous scolarisés. Son activité se localise à son lieu d'habitation et elle est aidée par 02 personnes. Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, et assurer la mécanisation de l'agriculture, Madame Mamantou sollicite un premier prêt à WAGES. Le profit tiré de son activité lui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs fixés.
texts.en: Born in 1970 and with a background in agriculture, Mamantou lives in KABOLI (village located in the Central region of Togo). She is married to a teacher and take care of five children, all of whom attend school. Her professional activity takes place at her home, and she is suppored by two persons.  In order to contribute to taking care of the needs of her family, as well as to ensure the agricultural machinery is in good working order, Mrs Mamantou is asking for her first loan from WAGES. Profits arising from her agricultural activity will allow her to achieve her objectives.

loans.use: to buy work tools and fertiliser

loans.name: Abagonarimwe Group

texts.fr:
Goreth fait partie du groupe  Abagonarimwe et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 40 ans et est marié à  Bangiricenge.Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants  âgés de 11 à 18 ans, tous étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, sel,…)   depuis 5 ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup  d’articles de sa boutique (riz, haricot, sel,…) à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait  voir ses enfants continuer les études.
texts.en:
Goreth is a member of the Abagonarimwe group, and lives in Gitega. She is 40 years old, and is married to Bangiricenge. They have five children together, aged from 11 to 18, all of whom are in school.
She has run a small store (selling rice, beans, salt, etc) for the last five years, and is on her fourth loan with Turame. 
With this Kiva loan, she will grow her working capital and buy a large quantity of stock for her store (rice, beans, salt, etc) that she will resell to make a profit. In the coming years, she would like to see her children continue their studies.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store (rice, beans, salt, etc) to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Aurelie Leonie

texts.fr: AURELIE est une femme marié de 39ans avec 05 enfants à sa charge dont le dernier à 5ans.AURELIE est une commerçante dans un marché de la place.elle à une alimentation et un moulin à écraser.au regard de la petitesse  son capital qui ne lui permet pas de satisfaire sa clientèle,elle solliciter un credit pour augmenter son stock de marchandise et accroître ses bénéfices.lesquels lui permettront de s'occuper de ses enfants
texts.en: AURELIE is a 39 year old married woman who takes care of 5 children, the youngest of whom is 5 years old. She is a shopkeeper in a store on the main square/plaza in the town, and has both a food section as well as a mill to grind things. The small amount of money she has does not allow her to satisfy the requests stemming from her client base. She is therefore asking for a long in order to purchase more merchandise to sell and in the process, increase her sales. The profits will allow her to take care of her children.

loans.use: increase her stock of merchandise

loans.name: Dominiciana

texts.en:
Dominiciana runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Dominiciana has been in business for more than 3 years now. This is the source of her income.

Dominiciana is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and detergents, cooking ingredients and seasoning and others. With this, she will be able to improve the diversity of her stocks which attracts more buyers to her store.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and detergents, cooking ingredients and seasoning and others

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 41 años, es madre de tres hijos de 20, 14 y 10 años respectivamente a quienes educa y cría con la finalidad de hacerlos personas productivas para la sociedad, ella está casada y comparte su casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos. María se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, entre los productos que vende destacan los que son usados en aseo y cuidado personal, tratamiento facial, colonias, perfumes, algunas joyas, ropa y otros. Su trabajo lo realiza en su casa o por las calles de la ciudad entre sus amigos y personas que conoce, cuando se inició en este trabajo hace 04 años le era complicado poder realizarlo con éxito ya que no sabía muy bien como lograr obtener a sus clientes, pero con el tiempo fue aprendiendo y capacitándose en técnicas de ventas, así pudo salir adelante y logró consolidarse como una vendedora exitosa. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles y está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará perfumes,rubores, joyas y accesorios para tener en stock disponible para sus clientes y brindarles nuevas opciones en modelos y aromas.
texts.en: María is 41 years old. She is the mother of three children, aged 20, 14 and 10, whom she is raising and educating to become productive people for society.   She is married and shares the home she owns with her husband and children. María sells cosmetics. Among the products she sells the ones that stand out at the ones used for personal hygiene and care, facial treatment, colognes, perfumes, some jewelry, clothing and more. She does her job at her home or in the streets of the city among her friends and people that she knows. When she started this work 4 years ago, it was hard to do it successfully because she didn't know how to get customers very well. Over time she learned and trained in sales techniques and was thus able to get ahead and make herself a successful saleswoman. At this time, she will ask for S/. 1500 soles. She is very grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to get ahead. She is also committed to making her payments on time. With the amount she has asked for, she will buy perfumes, blushes, jewelry and accessories to have stock available for her customers and offer them new options in types and aromas.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and women's accessories.

loans.name: Berenice Del Carmen

texts.es: Berenice, a sus 37 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos. Siempre ha vivido en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agropecuarias, gracias a las enseñanzas de su familia. Actualmente se dedica a la cría y engorde de cerdos y pollos, los cuales vende en el mercado del municipio donde reside y de esta manera genera los recursos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Berenice ha pasado por una situación económica difícil, pues toda la carga económica recae sobre ella por ser madre cabeza de hogar, pero con mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y perseverancia ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos. La cliente solicita el crédito con la intensión de invertirlo en la compra de insumos y concentrado para los animales, con lo que podrá engordarlos y luego venderlos a un mejor precio, aumentado su producción y los ingresos que recibe por cada venta, esto se verá reflejado en el mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida de su familia a mediano plazo, también podrá avanzar un poco más hacia el cumplimiento de sus principal sueño que es tener una producción escalonada que le garantice la entrada de recursos de manera más constante y estable, con lo que dará a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener una mejor educación y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Berenice, who is 37, is a single mother of 3 children.  She has always lived in the country, where she was taught how to do agricultural tasks by her family.  She currently breeds and fattens pigs and chickens which she sells at the market of the town where she lives.  This provides her with an income to support her family.  Berenice has been through a difficult time financially because, as a female breadwinner, the financial burden falls on her.  However, her effort, dedication and perseverance have enabled her to support her children.  She is applying for the loan to buy supplies and animal feed so she can fatten her livestock and then sell them for a better price.  This will allow her to increase production and revenue from each sale and, as a result, improve her family's living conditions in the medium term.  It will also enable her to get a bit closer to achieving her main ambition, which is to spread production throughout the year. This will guarantee a more regular and stable influx of resources which she will use to provide a better quality of life and the chance of a better education for her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Wendy Margarita

texts.es:
Wendy es una joven de 28 años de edad, es madre soltera, comparte vivienda con la mamá, persona de una edad aproximada a los 50 años, un hijo de 10 años de edad que estudia  3º. grado, un hijo de 8 años de edad que estudia 1º. Grado y un niño de 1 año 7 meses de edad. 

Se dedica a trabajar en la elaboración de tamales y pan de forma artesanal, esta actividad la realizan por tradición familiar, ella inició vendiendo desde que tiene 12 años. Actualmente, se encarga de elaborar  800 tamales de gallina  por semana, cada tamal lo vende a $0.25. El pan, lo hace una vez por semana, el día jueves en especial, generalmente realiza una venta que oscila entre $235.00 y 215.00. En este negocio su rentabilidad es del 40%. Las ventas las hacen ellas de casa en casa y personas que siempre les hacen pedidos, los que siempre confirman vía teléfono. Buscan personas para que les ayuden a vender, solo  si ella o la mamá  enferman.  En esta actividad emplean dos mujeres de forma eventual y les paga $5.00 por jornada.

El préstamo servirá  para la compra de materias primas como leña, maíz y harina de trigo. También, para construir techo y proteger el horno. Con el préstamo busca, fortalecer su negocio y proteger su horno artesanal de la lluvia.

Tiene la idea de crecer en el negocio de la producción de pan, quisiera, aplicar los conocimientos que adquirió en un curso de repostería y elaboración de pizzas que impartieron de parte de la alcaldía municipal de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Wendy, 28, is a young, single mother. She shares a house with her mother who is approximately 50 years old, a 10-year-old son who is in third grade, an 8-year-old son who is in first grade and a son who is 1 year and seven months old.

She works making tamales and homemade bread. These activities are a tradition in the family and she started selling when she was twelve years old. She is now making 800 chicken tamales weekly, each one sold at $0.25. She makes bread once a week, on Thursdays, and makes between $215 and $235 from selling it. Her profitability is 40% with this business. She and her mother sell at home and to people who put orders via the telephone. They only look for help when one gets sick; normally two women who get paid $5 per day.

This loan will help her to buy ingredients such as corn and wheat flour, and firewood. She will also build a roof to protect her oven. The loan will strengthen her business and will help her protect her traditional oven from the rain.

Her idea is to expand her bakery business. She would like to apply the knowledge she has from a bakery and pizza-making course she took with the city hall.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as corn and wheat flour, and firewood. Also, to build a roof to protect her oven.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy phones and DVD machines

loans.name: Soradji

texts.fr: Soradji est né en 1970. Il est marié, père de 05 enfants dont 03 scolarisés. Il réside à KABOLI avec sa famille et exerce également son activité au même lieu. Il est agriculteur. Avec son second crédit, monsieur Soradji souhaiterait acheter des outils de travail pour avoir un meilleur rendement. Le profit lui permettra d'acheter des bêtes pour élevage et assurer un avenir meilleur à la famille.
texts.en: Soradji was born in 1970. He is married and the father of 5 children, 3 of whom attend school. He lives in Kaboli with this family, and is involved in agricultural activity from his home. He is asking for a second loan in order to purchase work tools to enable him to be more efficient. He will use the profits to purchase animals to raise and ensure a better future for his family.

loans.use: purchase work tools

loans.name: Asefa

texts.en: Asefa was born in 1970. She lives with her husband and children in a rented house in Amman. Her husband retired and is currently working as a security guard which is a weak source of income to cover their children's needs. Asefa has 3 sons and 3 daughters. She started her project by visiting her friend in Aqaba which is a city in Jordan. From there she bought clothes and started trading them for the last 6 years. She has been facing an obstacle in her project which is having many competitors in the same area. She is planning to expand her project in the future by adding more variety to her products as she is planning to start trading cleaning products and make-up with the clothes. Now she is asking for a loan to buy more clothes to increase her sales in order to earn a good income and help her husband in covering their children needs.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 28 years old, married and blessed with 4 children. She runs a retail business in Kangundo town and has been in this business for 3 years. Besides the retail shop as her primary activity, she also sells scrap metals to metal industries.

This is her first loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of sugar, rice, bar soap and cooking oil to sell. This will enable her to have enough stock to meet her customers demands. She anticipates she will make more income which she will use to purchase more retail items to sell and also educate her children by paying for their school fees.

Tabitha hopes to grow her business, make more income and own a modern house for her family, as well as ensuring that her children get a good education.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jecklor

texts.en:
Jecklor is 51 years old and runs a retail shop in Kangundo town. She is widowed and a mother of six children. She has been in the business for 16 years and currently makes a monthly income of 12,000 Kenya Shillings.

This being her third loan term, she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of goods to sell. This includes cooking oil, rice, flour, sugar and household goods. She also plans to buy chicken and a start poultry business. She will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children.

Jecklor hopes to grow her retail shop and be successful in her business and hence be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a 45 year old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 2 children aged 19 and 21 year old respectively. She engages in cosmetology services. She provides manicure and pedicure services for a minimum fee. She has been doing cosmetology for almost 10 years. 

She is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear garments and materials like nail nippers, nail polish and various nail colors. Aside from cosmetology services, Janeth also sells ready-to-wear garments, to augment her income. In the future, Janeth would like to expand both her business' to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear garments and materials like nail nippers,nail polish and various nail colors.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past three years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her business, which is selling fruit. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase stock through buying jackfruits, mangoes, etc and will help Rebecca to generate greater profits. It will help to supplement these essential items. She hopes that in the future she will be able to build her house. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to increase her stock of jackfruit.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 37 years old and runs a retail business in Oloitoktok town where she sells basins, flasks, plastic water cans, hotpots and other household goods. She is married and blessed with three children. Her spouse also supports the family through farming. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

This being her third loan term with KADET LTD, she will use the loan to buy more stock of cooking pans, basins, flasks and metal cookers for sale. She will use the generated profits to buy her own farm and grow cash crops.

In future, Esther hopes to grow her business and make more income in order to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy plastic basins, flasks and household goods to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 55 años de edad, está casado con Graciela y tiene dos hijos de 20 y 18 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Carlos se dedica a la venta de pescados frescos, para eso se levanta muy de temprano y se dirige al puerto más cercano a comprar su mercadería, luego se dirige a los asentamientos humanos y pueblos jóvenes donde realiza la venta de manera ambulatoria caminando  por las calles su bandeja de pescados.  Se inició hace más de 02 años con un capital propio y hasta el momento lo viene realizando solo. Se decidió empezar éste negocio por la necesidad de contar con un oficio y obtener ingresos para sostener los gatos de su familia. Por otro lado, viendo los buenos resultados que tiene con su negocio, desea abrir una tienda de productos comestibles, para así obtener un poco más de ingresos . Este será su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles, comprará pescados al por mayor.
texts.en:
Carlos, 55, is married to Graciela and has two children who are 18 and 20 years old and who live with him in their own house.  Carlos makes a living selling fresh fish.  To do this he gets up very early and goes to the nearest port to buy his merchandise.  Then he goes to the settlements and new towns where he makes his sales as a street vendor, walking through the streets with his tray of fish.  

He began this more than two years ago with his own capital and so far he works alone.  He decided to start this business because he needed a job to rely on and to make an income in order to cover the expenses of his family.  On the other hand, seeing the success he has had with his business he wishes to open a grocery store in order to make a little more of an income.  

This will be his fourth Kiva loan and he is grateful for the financial report that he receives in order to get ahead in life.  Additionally, he promises to make his repayments in a punctual manner.  With the requested amount of 500 nuevos soles he will buy fish at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy fish at wholesale.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married lady aged 29 and blessed with 2 children aged 8 and 6 years old.  Her spouse Ben also adds income to the family.  Patricia sells second hand clothes in Eldama Ravine location and has been in the business for a period of 3 years earning an income of KES 9,000 monthly.

She is now servicing her 2nd loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to pay school fees for her sibling who is in college.  The profits she earns from her business will be used to repay the loan.

Her dream is expand her current business and invest more in future developments.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her sibling

loans.name: Pampille

texts.en:
Pamphille is 22 years old and single. He has a clothes selling business in Nairobi's Thika road area where he sells 2nd hand clothes. He has been in this business for one year and currently makes a monthly income of 5,000 Kenyan Shillings.

This being his first loan term, he will use the loan to buy shirts, t-shirts, sweaters, skirts, blouses and trousers to sell. He plans to use the anticipated profits to buy more varieties of clothes to sell.

Pampille hopes to grow his business and open a boutique shop and thereby be successful in his business.

loans.use: To add more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 49 years old, and married with two children aged 23 and 17 years old. He runs a grocery shop and a mobile money transfer (M-Pesa) business in Nairobi town. His wife also provides additional income which they use to support their family and parents. He has been in the business for 7 years. 

He plans to use the loan to add more vegetables, tomatoes, onions and cereals to his greengrocery. He also plans to add more money float to his M-pesa business. This will be his 3rd loan term with KADET LIMITED. He will use the generated profits to acquire a permanent asset such as land. 

Kennedy hopes to open more grocery shops and mobile money transfer businesses in other places, make more income and provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, tomatoes and cereals to sell

loans.name: Collette

texts.en: Collette is 30 years old. She sells stationery materials and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more books and pens as now is the time that students go back to school and the demand is very high. She will use the profits to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more books and pens to sell.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en: Marie Rose is married with three children aged between 2 and 8, two of whom go to school. She has spent three years in the business of selling beers and sodas in a bar. She has requested the loan to buy more beers to sell. She plans to use the profits to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more beers and sodas to sell

loans.name: Janargul

texts.ru: Жанаргул 35 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Жанаргул- среднее образование. Супруг и все дети помогают по хозяйству. Жанаргул в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с покупки скота на 16,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жанаргул и ее семьи, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 головы крупного рогатого скота, а также 15 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жанаргул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки мелкого рогатого скота. Доходы от кредита Жанаргул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашины.
texts.en: Janargul is 35 years old and she is married with five children.  She has a high school education and her husband and all her children help her around the farm.  Janargul raises livestock, which is the family's main source of income.  She started this business 12 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 16,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to the hard work of Janargul and her family, her farm now has two cows and 15 sheep and goats, which bring in a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Janargul has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to increase her head of livestock by purchasing sheep and goats.  She plans to use the income from this loan to increase her head of livestock, and she also plans on saving up money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. Elpedia has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 6 years now. Elpedia is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, and feed for the pigs.
Elpedia believes that this loan could help her improve her hog raising business. In the future, she also wants to expand this venture in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 29 years old. She is married and has two children between the ages of one and five. She has spent two years in the business of selling various items. With the loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil, rice, and sugar for resale. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings and to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice, and sugar for resale

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a 26-year-old single mother who supports a family of two. She runs a retail shop in Kipsitet trading centre in Nandi County served by KADET Ltd's Kapsabet office. This has been her income generating business for the last two years.

Edith gets an average monthly profit of 30,000 KES. She has borrowed a second loan of 100,000 KES. With this loan, she plans to use the amount borrowed of 100,000 KES to purchase maize flour, sugar, tea leaves, bar soaps, rice and cooking fat, among other items.

She anticipates getting profits from the business which she will use to pay her children’s school fees and expand her business.  Her dreams and hopes are to expand her business into a general wholesaler and also be able to educate her children to the highest education level possible.

loans.use: to purchase stock for the retail shop

loans.name: Saadatkan

texts.ru: Саадаткан 51 год, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Саадаткан - средне-специальное образование, работает в местной школе в качестве завхоза. Саадаткан в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Саадаткан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 лошади, а также 15 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Саадаткан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки мелкого рогатого скота. Доходы от кредита Саадаткан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Saadatkan is 51 years old and widowed.  Since the death of her husband, she has been taking care of three children and running the household by herself.  Saadatkan has a high school education and works in the local school as a caretaker.  To earn extra money for her family, she also raises livestock, which she started doing 10 years with the purchase of animals for 15,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Saadatkan's hard work, her farm now has three horses and 15 head of sheep and goats, which bring in a monthly income of 6,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Saadatkan has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to increase her head of livestock by purchasing sheep and goats.  She plans to use the income from this loan to make her herd even greater, and she also plans to save up money to make repairs on her home.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase stock levels of cassava

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 35 years old. She is married with seven children. She sells retail business items and has been in the business for the past five years. For this loan, Joyce would like to buy more rice and basins for resale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice and basins for sale

loans.name: Abigail Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una mujer de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus dos pequeños hijos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Mercedes no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Mercedes trabaja como recepcionista en un hotel de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Mercedes se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará y reforzara una habitación de su vivienda con materiales adecuados y resistentes, así pues Mercedes seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción total de su hogar.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a 27 year old woman. She lives in the city of Chincha with her two small children. She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who puts all her efforts into getting her family ahead, because she is both father and mother to her children. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Mercedes hasn’t been able to study for the nursing degree that she had wanted.

Through her own initiative, Mercedes works as a receptionist in a hotel in her city. She works about 10 hours every day, and she believes that it is going well for her due to her dedication and her good performance.

Mercedes is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they have given she will improve and reinforce a room in her home with suitable, hard-wearing materials. In this way, Mercedes can continue working and putting forth effort to achieve her dream of finishing the complete construction of her home.

loans.use: To make improvements in her home.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a young lady aged 28 years from Rwentondo, Kakoba Division in Mbarara district. She got married at the early age of 17 years. They stayed together for some years and produced 4 children. Later the man became very violent to the extent that he was beating her. Because of fear for her dear life, she decided to divorce this man and she went with the children.

Life became difficult as she had no source of income, so she decided to start up a business of selling produce with the loan she got from Ugafode. She later saved some money and built a house for her children. She is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to complete her house. She thanks Ugafode for being there in her time of need.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of cloth to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more provisions to sell, which will help her to improve her sales.

loans.name: Nurhasanah

texts.en:
Nurhasanah lives in Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Nurhasanah is married and living with three persons in the family home. 

Nurhasanah began working with Ruma seven months ago because she was interested in the income for selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments.
