Her vending stand is located in the District of Villa del Carmen, where buses pass through on the way to Los Yungus.  Her wish is to have a shop where she can offer a variety of products and increase her clientele.  As a result, she can generate more income.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Bryan Antonello Walter

texts.es:
Bryan tiene 20 años de edad, trabaja en una institución de su ciudad y con los ingresos de su trabajo solventa sus gastos de estudio, ya que actualmente se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Derecho.

Bryan está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá pagar sus mensualidades y de esa manera estar al día en los pagos, lo que le permitirá seguir estudiando y luchar por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su propio estudio jurídico”.
texts.en:
Bryan is 20 and works at an establishment in his city and uses his income to to pay for his education; he is currently studying for a law degree.

He really appreciates Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to pay his monthly tuition and be up to date on his payments, which will allow him to stay in school and fight to realize his biggest dream: to have his own law firm.

loans.use: to pay his monthly university tuition.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother). She sells used clothes and has been in this business for ten years.

She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) from MCDTSACCO to buy more jeans trousers, shirts and skirts. She generates additional income through selling piped water. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells to all categories of people but on retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.

She aspires to become a wholesaler and to generate enough profits to build a commercial building. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 39-year-old married woman who is running a business selling milk, with the support of her husband. She has one cow, which she uses to get milk to sell to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Safia has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her second loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Safia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 33-year-old married woman who has been in the business of selling milk for the past five years. She has three buffaloes and two cows that she uses for milk sales in her community. She also deals in the sale and purchase of animals to generate extra income. She is a mother of two and is very motivated to provide her children with a beautiful life, including a good education, food, and clothing.

Asia has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. She has requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) from the Kashf Foundation to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to gain an increase in milk production capacity, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 4 children. The oldest is 17, while the youngest is 2.

Alicia runs a sari-sari (variety) store; she has been in the business for almost 3 years. She sells various items ranging from noodles, seasonings, and cooking oil to biscuits, eggs, and canned goods. She requested a loan of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional soft drinks, a sack of rice, and pig feed. In the future, she would like to expand her business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, a sack of rice, and pig feed

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is an 18-year-old single man who started working in agriculture four years ago. He specializes in planting and harvesting tobacco in small greenhouses.

Abdallah is a hard worker who puts in a lot of effort to support his parents and develop his business and standard of living. He is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy plastic shades he needs for his greenhouses. The shades will help him increase his production and properly invest in his working space.

Abdallah is planning to expand his greenhouses and diversify his products to improve his socioeconomic situation and to broaden his market.

loans.use: To buy plastic shades for his greenhouses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy organic manure for his diverse plantings.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of an additional family member (her mother). She has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for many years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income by selling charcoal. She moves door to door selling used clothes and sells on retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her movements. She aspires to get a permanent business location and also to build her own house. She currently resides in a rented house. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 33 years old, single, and runs a tailoring business in Nairobi town. He has been in this business for five years and he has been able to support his parents and siblings with the income that he gets from the business.

This being his second loan term, he plans to use the loan to buy more stocks of textile materials for sewing. He also plans to buy thread and buttons. 

Joseph hopes to grow his business and open more tailoring shops and, thereby, provide employment to other people.

loans.use: to buy textile materials for sewing.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, who is 43 years old, runs a dry cleaning shop in Kitengela town. She is the single mother of one child. She has been doing this business for the past five years and it has been profitable. She currently makes a monthly income of 8,000 Kenya Shillings.

This is her first loan term with KADET LTD and she will use the loan to purchase another dry cleaning machine for her business. This will enable her to meet the high demand of her customers as well as satisfy their needs. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her daughter by paying for her school fees.

In the future, Mary hopes to have a successful business and a happy family.

loans.use: To buy a dry cleaning machine for her business.

loans.name: Maria Marcelina

texts.es: María Marcelina de 60 años de edad es una mujer muy luchadora y entregada por su trabajo. Vive desde hace 10 años en su casa y da gracias a Dios que es propia, desde hace un tiempo se quedó viuda así que ella misma ha salido adelante por ella trabajando con esfuerzo diariamente. María vende productos de limpieza de hogar desinfectantes de diferentes olores, detergentes en variedad y además vende también café en bolsa es comerciante y sufraga pequeñas tiendas aledañas por su casa, es una mujer muy admirable por quienes la conocen pues saben lo que ha sufrido pero así mismo se ha sabido levantar y salir adelante. Ella tiene un sueño ya que poco a poco ha ido mejorando su hogar quiere tener un servicio sanitario lavable para que no tenga mayores limitantes es por eso que solicitó a FUSAI un préstamo el cual con esfuerzos pagará para y porque también a ella le interesa que su hogar esté impecable; agradece las manos que le permitirán realizar su sueño pues es una necesidad para su vivienda.
texts.en:
60-year old María Marcelina is a hardworking woman dedicated to her work. She has lived for ten years in her home which, thankfully, is her own. For some time now she has been a widow so she has had to make a daily effort to make her own way in the world. She sells cleaning products such as disinfectants with different scents, a range of detergents, as well as coffee in bags to small stores in the neighbourhood.

María is woman who is admired by all who know her. They know that although she suffered, she picked herself up and moved on.

After gradually completing repairs to her house, her dream is to have a toilet and bathroom so she has asked FUSAI for a loan which she will pay back whenever she can. She would love to have a clean home. María is grateful to have the chance to fulfill her dream.

loans.use: Buy a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel de 25 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de computadoras, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede llegar a atender hasta 10 clientes en el día, Manuel cree que está saliendo adelante con su negocio porque es responsable y sobre todo le gusta lo que hace.

Manuel está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar autopartes de computadores como por ejemplo pacas madres, con lo cual podrá atender los pedidos de sus clientes; de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un local propio y su negocio sea mas grande”.
texts.en:
Manuel, 25, lives in the city of Ica. He works at his business, selling computers, about nine hours a day and takes care of about 10 clients each day. Manuel believes he has been successful because he is responsible and likes what he does.

Manuel thanks the Kiva lenders, whose support will allow him to buy computer parts such as motherboards so that he can fulfill customer orders. He will be able to increase his income and keep working to achieve his greatest dream: having his own shop and a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy computer parts.

loans.name: Juan Roberto

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 21 años,es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos,el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Jan no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional,
Por iniciativa propia, Juan trabaja como agente de seguridad en una empresa que brinda servicios de vigilancia en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bine por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorara su vivienda, ya que desea reforzar las paredes y tarrajearlas, de esta manera el y su familia tendrán mayor bienestar, así pues Juan seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Juan is 21, single, and lives in the city of Pisco with his parents and siblings.  He's a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to overcome.  Unfortunately, due to lack of finances and the need to work, he was not able to go to school for a professional degree.  

By his own initiative, Juan works as a security agent for a company that provides security services in his city.  He works every day for about 10 hours and believes it's going well because of his own dedication and hard work.  

Juan really appreciates Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to improve his house.  He needs to reinforce and plaster the walls to improve his family's well-being.  He'll keep on working and making the effort to achieve his great dream of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to improve his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Nuzat

texts.en: Nuzat is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband in a corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Nuzat is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of two. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for the past three years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 15000 to buy thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 37 años,vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, Luis trabaja como obrero en una empresa textil de su ciudad, adicionalmente tiene una pequeña cancha de fútbol que alquila, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará su vivienda ya que desea tarrajear, pintar y poner piso de concreto a su hogar, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda, para que así su familia tenga mayor seguridad y bienestar.
texts.en:
Luis, 37, lives in the city of Chincha with his wife and three children. He is very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic. He and his wife dedicate themselves to providing for their family. Luis is employed by a textile firm in the city and also rents out his small soccer field. He works every day for about 12 hours and believes things are going well due to his determination and efforts.

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders, whose help will allow him to remodel his house. He wants to plaster and paint the walls and pour a concrete floor. He will keep working toward his great dream of finishing his house, which will improve his family's safety and well being.

loans.use: to remodel his house.

loans.name: La Richesse (2.1) Group

texts.en:
Gildas is a member and leader of the group La Richesse (2.1), which consists of seven micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. He is married with one child who is 5 years old and is attending primary school. This is his third loan cycle with HOPE Congo, and he is going to use his portion of the loan to purchase prepaid phone cards from a wide variety of networks in Brazzaville, including MTN, Airtel, Warid, and Azur. He has been working in prepaid card sales since 2007 and has learned that he must help his customers use the cards properly to reload their phones and recharge their credit. Customers must pay close attention to entering the recharge codes, or they may become frustrated with his product.

In the future, Gildas hopes to move from just selling cards without a fixed location to having a small boutique for more stability in his work. With his increased income, he also hopes to build and make improvements to his housing situation for his young family.

loans.use: to buy prepaid phone cards from a variety of networks in Brazzaville.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is married and has five children, and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes feeding the family and paying utility bills.  

She has a business selling milk. She has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more cans of milk to sell. She generates additional income through raising chickens. She sells on a wholesale basis only, and she works in a shop that she rents. She works seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include defaulters and the perishibilty of milk. She aspires to own a big deep freezer, to accommodate all her milk. Also, she aspires to buy a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more cans of milk to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Margaret. She and her fiance are living together, and he is a contractor. They have three children between 5 and 17 years, and all of their children are in school and live at home. Margaret was fortunate to finish 12th grade. She described herself as a hardworking businesswoman. For the past three years she has been selling roasted fish and chicken along the roadside in order to help her children. She started this business with 5000 LRD, and she learned this business from her uncle's wife. She likes her business because she makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish, pepper, seasoned oil, vita, black pepper and chicken for her business. Her dream is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish, pepper, seasoned oil, vita, black pepper, and chicken for her business,

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 27-year-old businessman working in the transportation industry. He is married to Mary, with whom he is blessed to have one child. George has operated a motorcycle transportation business for the past 10 years and has a monthly income of 10,500 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family. He also does farming to supplement his income.

George will use the loan to buy a piece of land so he can expand his farming. He will plough the expected profit from his farm back into the business and also improve the living standards of his family. His hopes and dreams are to give his child a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene makes and supplies school uniforms, to several primary schools in Nairobi town. She is 24 years old, married, and has been blessed with three children. Her spouse, who is a construction worker, also provides income to support the family. Irene has been in her business for three years and makes an income of 15,000 Kenya Shillings a month. 

This is her first loan with KADET. She will use the loan to buy materials for making school uniforms to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay her loan and to improve her business by buying more sewing materials. Irene hopes to build a residential home for her family, in her rural place.

loans.use: To buy materials for making school uniforms.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael, 32, is married and has a four-year-old child. He has one additional dependent who lives with him. In 2007 Michael opened his food and drink shop. Previously, he was working at the front desk in one of the hotels in town. Because of the poor pay, he decided to set up his own business with his savings. Working seven days a week and fourteen hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month.

Michael is requesting a loan of Le 6,000,000. He has already successfully repaid his previous loan, and now he needs a new loan. He will use it to buy a brand new freezer and some crates of soft drinks. This loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 1,000,000 SLL.  Michael is still striving hard to construct a house, in future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a brand new freezer and some crates of soft drinks.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 49-year-old hotel owner. She is the widowed mother of four children who fully depend on her. Pauline has been running her hotel for the past ten years with a monthly income of 25,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. Pauline is applying for her eighth loan with KADET. She is grateful for the financial support that has been offered to her by KADET and KIVA. 

She will use the loan to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour, and plastic chairs. With the expected profit from the business, she will pay school fees for her children and also reinvest in her business.  

Her hope and dream is to open a bigger hotel in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour, and plastic chairs.

loans.name: La Richesse (2.2) Group

texts.en:
Privat is one of the members of the group La Richesse (2.2) and is the leader of a group consisting of seven micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. 

Privat is married and this is his very first loan cycle with HOPE Congo S.A. Privat has been operating his restaurant in Brazzaville since 2003 and will use the loan to purchase a variety of drinks and more chairs for his customers. His secret to operating his restaurant is good management of his activities and ensuring that he maintains an excellent relationship with his customers. 

In the future, Privat has dreams of opening a new V.I.P. section of his restaurant that would be used and rented by customers who would like to have a more private dining experience. 

For his family, he hopes to improve his living conditions and he continues to be an active member in his community, where his neighbors have affectionately nicknamed him 'President Obama' for his diplomatic and outgoing character.

loans.use: to increase his stocks of drinks and buy more chairs for customers at his restaurant.

loans.name: Bartola

texts.es:
Doña Bartola  es una mujer que trabaja en el campo de la agricultura. Ella tiene 37 años de edad, y está casada.  Vive  junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos de los cuales 2 hombres y 2 mujeres, en el Sector Los Chumil, Caserío Central Cantón el Tablón Sololá, Sololá.
Ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz, en el lugar de su vivienda. Empezó esta actividad porque puede asegurar la alimentación de su familia durante un año y lo puede comercializar en el mercado local.
Ahora lleva 20 años trabajando en la agricultura y es como de esta manera ella obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le ayudan a contribuir en los gastos de su familia.
Ella ha observado que su cultivo le genera varios beneficios es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para comprar abono orgánico para cultivo de maíz. 
Su mayor sueño es sacar adelante a sus hijos en sus estudios para que puedan tener mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Bartola, 37, is a farmer. She is married and lives with her husband and four children, two boys and two girls, in the Los Chumil neighborhood of Caserío Central in El Tablón canton, Sololá. She grows corn on land next to her house. She began farming to ensure that her family had food throughout the year and so that she had merchandise to sell at the local market.

She has been farming for 20 years and has been able to earn enough income and profit to help pay household expenses. She recognizes that her crops generate profits and has applied for a loan of Q 4,000 to buy organic fertilizer for her corn crop. Her great dream is to educate her children so that they have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her corn crop.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 29 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has two children aged 3 and 9 who live with her and are attending school. For five years, she has been selling bread along with butter. She sells every day in the morning and evening and has a regular group of customers whom she visits regularly to deliver bread and butter. She sells on credit to some clients and is sometimes unable to collect all the money owed on time. She likes to make her own money with the business.

Betty has requested a loan to purchase more bread and butter. In the future, she wants to be her own boss and wants her children to live a good life. She thanks BRAC Liberia for its continuous support.

loans.use: to purchase more bread and butter.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley lives in West Point, which has one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 29 years old, single and has three children between 2 and 16 years old. Two of them are in school and all of them live at home. For the past three years she has been frying and selling plantains, chicken, fish, and cala (dough like) in her community. She got the money to start this business from her oldest sister. She is requesting a loan to purchase more plantains, fish, flour, pepper, etc. for her  business. She wishes to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more plantains, fish, flour pepper, etc. for her  business,

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 23 years old and lives in Montserrado County near the capital city of Liberia, which is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is single and has a two-year-old child who stays at home. She is a 10th grade dropout. For the past three years she has been selling coal from a shop in the local market. Her major problem is that the price of coal is very high. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of coal for her business. She plans to live a better life and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of coal for her business.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 42 years old, is from Naivasha, and is married to Margaret; they have three children who are in school.

Anthony has a transportation business that he has operated for the past 2 years. He has applied for his fifth loan from KADET Ltd. so he can open a kiosk, where he intends to sell sugar, rice, and maize flour, among other things. With the anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees. He also hopes to own a taxi in the near future to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy stock for a kiosk, including sugar, rice, and maize flour

loans.name: Llerle

texts.es:
Llerle tiene 43 años, es madre de 3 hijos de 20, 17 y 7 años, a quienes quiere muchísimo y lucha cada día ´para darles una vida digna; es por ello que Llerle trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de tortas y también vende calzado, su pequeño negocio es su única fuente de ingresos es por ello que cada día se esfuerza por atender a sus clientes de manera amable ya que de ello depende el futuro de su familia.

Llerle está muy agradecida con el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias  a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar mas zapatos para poder vender en su negocio, de esta manera tendrá mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer y mejorar sus ingresos, así ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una gran pastelería y poder tener un local propia para la venta de zapatos”.
texts.en:
Llerle, 43, is the mother of three children, ages 20, 17, and 7.  She loves them very much and strives every day to give them a decent life.

This is why she works in her small business selling cakes.  She also sells footwear.  Her small business is her only source of income and her family's future depends on it, so she makes the effort every day to give her customers friendly service.

Llerle's very grateful for the support she's getting from Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy more shoes to sell in her business.  This way she'll have a wider variety of products to sell and improve her income.

She'll continue striving to make her biggest dream come true: "To have a great pastry shop and her own place to sell shoes."

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Wendy Pamela

texts.es:
Wendy tiene 18 años de edad, con mucho esfuerzo y  pesar de pocos recursos económicos se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad; para poder solventar, los gastos de sus estudios trabaja como asistente en una pequeña empresa de su ciudad y ella cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es responsable y desea superarse en la vida.

Gracias al apoyo de los prestamistas kiva Wendy podrá comprar una computadora para poder realizar sus trabajos estudiantiles ya que actualmente tiene que alquilar cabinas de internet, así ella podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser una gran profesional y poder tener su empresa propia”.
texts.en:
Wendy, 18, is diligently studying accounting, despite having little money. She works as an assistant at a small firm in the city to pay for her education, and she believes she is successful because she is responsible and wants to get ahead. 

Thanks to Kiva lenders, Wendy will be able to buy a computer to do her school work, instead of using Internet cafes as she does now. She will be able to continue striving to achieve her dream of being a professional and having her own business.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Yeanor

texts.en: This is 50-year-old Yeanor. She is widowed but has four grown children. In 2000, Yeanor established her business selling beer, stout, soft drinks, and other provisions. She began her business to generate funds to sustain her children who were then in school, after the demise of her husband. Working six days a week for 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Yeanor requires a loan in order to buy beer, stout, and some other provisions. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 800,000 SLL. In the future, Yeanor plans to expand her shop. She is very hardworking, and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy beer, stout, and some other provisions.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 51 years old and is married and blessed with six children, some of whom are grown up. She buys and sells rice and has been in the business for the last ten years. She also own “Tuk-tuk,” which transports people around, for additional income.

Sofia learned about Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy bags of rice for resale. Her current ambition is to diversify her business and open another to increase her income. The major challenge in her business has been finding customers. The extra income she will raise from the business will help her pay the college fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is 35 years old and married to Esther. They have three children who are in school.

Duncan has a carpentry business in Naivasha, which he has been running for the past ten years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy timber for his business. He plans to buy more stock for his business with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, Duncan hopes to own the biggest workshop in Naivasha.

loans.use: to purchase timber.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar, no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica que desea.
Por iniciativa propia, David trabaja en un cervicentro arreglando los aceites y lavando las unidades vehículares, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
David se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará un pequeño motor de aire, el cual le servira de mucho para realizar su trabajo, así pues David seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio lavado de autos.
texts.en:
David is 22 years old, single, and lives in the city of Pisco with his parents and siblings.  He is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic man with a great desire to succeed.  Unfortunately he was not able to complete his studies as a mechanical engineer like he wanted, due to lack of resources.

David works at a service center, doing oil changes and washing vehicles.  He works about 10 hours a day and believes that things are going well for him because of his effort and dedication.

David is grateful to the Kiva lenders and thanks to their help, he will buy a small air compressor that will be very helpful to him in his work.  David will continue working and striving to achieve his dream of having his own car wash.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en: Emely lives in Sibula, Misamis Occidental with her family. She is 41 year old and has three children. Her husband worked as an AFP (Armed Forces of the Philippines) while she managed their farm and cattle to make a living. For many years of doing this, she earned 3,500 PHP monthly from its farm. She successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC, which she used for their farm inputs. Recently, she requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy a young cow to raise. She will use her generated revenue to improve her farm and for the good future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a young cow to raise.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single, 53-year-old mother of three, in Thika.  Margaret has been running a grocery store for the past six years, with a monthly income of KES 13,500. She uses her income to support her family.

Margaret is applying for her third loan from KADET, after having repaid her previous loans successfully. She will use the new loan to purchase five bags of potatoes for KES 40,000 and two bags of carrots for KES 10,000. She will use the additional income to repay her loan, and to improve the standard of living of her family. She hopes to educate her children to college level and secure their future.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and carrots to resell at her grocery store

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Aminata.  She is married and has two children aged ten and four. In 2009, Aminata established her cooking utensil business. The business started to help her husband, who is a miner, to run the affairs of the home. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are women.

 Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Aminata has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional laundry tubs, enamel spoons, coolers, and food flasks. She hopes that this loan can increase stock and raise profits.


 In the future, Aminata plans to expand the business to a town out of the city, and she hopes to be able to raise enough profit to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for cooking utensils

loans.name: Zhana

texts.en:
Zhana is a 38-year-old divorced woman. She lives with her 12-year-old daughter in the capital city of Georgia.

Her family generates very little sources of income. Zhana’s retired parents assist her to feed her daughter and to cover their everyday costs. Zhana has graduated from a pedagogical college but she is unable to find a job in this profession because there is high unemployment in the region. So, she looks after her daughter and stays at home, but she has a great desire to be involved in a trading business.

Zhana has been unable to secure any loans from local financial institutions because they require borrowers to have business experience or stable earnings. But the Start Up program, which is a joint effort of Kiva and Credo, provides vulnerable poor people like Zhana with a chance to start or re-start businesses.

She requested a loan in the amount of $600 to begin trading in clothing and linens. She plans to go to Turkey to purchase the products at wholesale prices and to then re-sell among her community members for profits. She believes that the loan proceeds would allow her to earn income and to become financially independent. In the future, with the help of the Start Up program, Zhana would like to save up her money and to provide a better future for her daughter.

loans.use: to start a business by purchasing clothing and linens for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Anarbubu

texts.ru: Анарбубу 65 лет, разведена, одна воспитала 2 детей. Старший сын женат, дочь незамужем, работает в архитектуре. У Анарбубу - среднее образование. Анарбубу в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Анарбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 головы крупного рогатого скота, 2 нетели, 3 козы и 15 голов овец, ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анарбубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 6,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 1 головы крупного рогатого скота. Доходы от кредита Анарбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на обучение своих внуков в высших учебных заведениях.
texts.en: Anarbubu is 65 years old. She is divorced and has brought up two children on her own. Her oldest son is married. Her daughter is single and works as an architect. Anarbubu has received secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Anarbubu raises livestock, having launched this business 20 years ago by purchasing livestock for 10,000 KGS. Thanks to Anarbubu’s hard work, her farm now has two heads of cattle, two heifers, three goats and 15 sheep. Her montly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to develop her farm further, ANarbubu has turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance institution for a loan in the  amount of 6,000 KGS to increase her livestock by purchasing one head of cattle. Anarbubuy plans to use her revenues into a further increase of livestock. She plans to save up for her grandchildren’s college tuition.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora, es una mujer sencilla, luchadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Meyer, con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero solo cuida de la última en su casa propia. Ella se encuentra delicada de salud, comenta con tristeza que extraña los días en los que salía a trabajar desde el amanecer y llegar hasta muy noche. Desde pequeña se dedicó a la agricultura, la que hasta el día de hoy le brindó el dinero necesario para comprar su casa, los terrenos agrícolas, el tractor y la camioneta que posee. Ahora siembra papa, maíz y demás productos pero en baja escala y necesita del apoyo de trabajadores del lugar para que pueda mantener y cosechar sus terrenos; pues ya no tiene la misma fuerza, “trabajaré hasta que me muera, me gusta mucho el campo”, afirma. Pero como ella es una mujer dedicada, gusta de estar ocupada por lo que tiene vacas lechera de las que extrae diariamente leche, además de cuyes en cantidad que comercializa a un empresa de manera constante. Ahora ella desea dedicar la totalidad de su tiempo a la crianza de cuyes, pues no necesita de esfuerzo físico. Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo que le brindaron, pues podrá seguir invirtiendo en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Dora, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de calaminas y el pago del albañil para la construcción de un nuevo establo para sus cuyes.
texts.en:
Dora is an honest, hardworking woman who lives with her husband, Meyer, and their 5 children, 4 of whom are now adults. Dora's health has deteriorated in recent years, and she no longer has the strength to work from sunrise to sunset like she has in the past. From a young age she has worked in agriculture and has leveraged her income over the years to buy a house, a tractor, a parcel of land for farming and a small truck for her family. She presently grows potatoes, corn and other crops on a small scale, but she needs more help tending and harvesting her crops these days, as she is weaker than she has been. Despite pain and challenges, Dora affirms that, "I will work until I die, because I love the countryside and my land."

As an active woman with lots of energy, Dora also raises guinea pigs for resale and keeps dairy cows that she milks every day. Given her health challenges, she hopes to transition to only raising guinea pigs, as that work is easier on her body. This is her first loan with Kiva, and she promises to make all scheduled repayments on time. Dora is very grateful for the support she has received, and she plans to leverage the funds from this loan to strengthen her business and pay for a mason to build her a small shed for her guinea pigs.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and build a shed where she can keep her guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old single man from Jenin City. He works as an employee in the public sector and gets a low income; this income barely covers his needs. 

Mohammad would like to complete his studies and get a master's degree and maybe, in the future, a PHD. 

He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him pay the university installments. This will help him with part of the necessary expenses and will ensure him to get a better job in the future. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments

loans.name: Manolita

texts.en:
Manolita is 53 years old, married and works hard to help her husband earn a living.

Manolita is engaged in the tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional fabric and a sewing machine for her business.

Manolita has been tailoring for 10 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Manolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fabric and a sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Milton Silverio

texts.es:
Milton de 18 años de edad, es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de cuyes y servicios de mecánica desde hace algunos meses, con los ingresos que le brinda su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar; el cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es mu responsable y sobre todo atiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad.

Milton está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para poder construir criaderos para sus cuyes y también podrá comprar herramientas para su pequeño taller, de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un gran criaderos de cuyes y u taller mucho más grande”.
texts.en:
Milton, 18, is a young man who very much wants to get ahead.  Several months ago he managed with great effort to start his own small business selling guinea pigs and providing mechanical services.  With the income from his job he's able to help his parents with the household expenses.  He thinks he's getting ahead because he's very responsible and provides friendly service to his customers.

Milton's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to buy supplies to build cages for his guinea pigs and tools for his small repair shop.

This way he'll improve his income and continue striving to make his biggest dream come true: to have a large guinea pig nursery and a much bigger shop.

loans.use: to build cages for his guinea pigs and to buy tools

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
This is forty-six-year-old Eddie.  He is married and has four children, aged seven, fifteen, eighteen and twenty-two. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to help with the housekeeping chores.

In 1995, Eddie established his business, where he sells t-shirts, button-down shirts, school bags, perfumes and umbrellas. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant, after coming from the mines. His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,774,075 every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Eddie has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and now he requires a new loan in order to buy additional goods to sell, including school bags, exercise books, school shoes, socks and belts. He hopes that this loan will increase his profit, by increasing the stock at his store.

In the future, Eddie plans to open another shop for his brother to manage.  His brother has just come from the village. In addition, Eddie hopes to be able to raise enough profit to complete the house he is constructing. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to increase his stock of goods for sale

loans.name: La Richesse (2.3) Group

texts.en:
Jean Fortuné is one of the members of the group known as La Richesse (2.3). He is the leader of this group that consists of seven micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo.

Since 2006, Jean Fortuné has been operating a cafeteria. He is now in his seventh loan cycle with HOPE Congo. He explains that one of his primary business challenges is the seasonal nature of his business. For instance, children are some of his primary customers, yet they have not returned to school, so his business has been slow as of late. By September, his cafeteria will be busy again when the children return to school.

He would like to use the requested loan proceeds to purchase a wider variety of food items for his customers, such as sausages. In the future, Jean Fortuné has dreams of opening a large restaurant and travelling more to select better ingredients for his customers. He also hopes to improve his family's living conditions and to eventually to save enough money to buy a vehicle which would allow him to have more flexibility in his regular travel around the Brazzaville.

loans.use: The borrower will use this loan to provide additional choices for his cafeteria's customers

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña Katupyry gracias a su arduo trabajo ya esta en su ciclo numero 10 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son mujeres que decidieron trabajar y luchar, ya que vieron que esta es la única forma de poder cumplir con sus ideales.
Una de las integrantes digna de destacar es la Sra. Guillermina, quien tiene una huerta que ella misma siembra, y luego cosecha, por medio de la venta de sus hortalizas lucha por tener los medios para ayudar a su familia. Es una persona muy sacrificada, que con mucho esfuerzo esta saliendo adelante.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para la compra de materiales agrícolas para utilizarlo en su huerta y así seguir luchando por mejorar sus ingresos y por dar a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Kuña Katupyry is now in its tenth cycle in the Women’s Committee program.  These are ladies who decided to work and exert themselves because they believe that this is the only way to meet their ideals.

Guillermina is one of the members and she has a plot where she raises and harvests vegetables.  She works to have the means to help her family.  She is one who makes sacrifices and is getting ahead this way.  She is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies to use on her plot and continue working to improve her income and provide her customers with what they need.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Mujeres Emprendedoras que lleva por nombre San Cayetano se encuentra en el 6to. Ciclo del programa de Comité de Mujeres con 15 integrantes actualmente, es caracterizado por su responsabilidad, cumplimiento en el pago participación en las capacitaciones , agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por el por la oportunidad que reciben ya que de esta forma podrán mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a sus familias.
 Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora  Felipa de 62 años, que se dedica al macate (venta ambulante) de todo tipo de productos, ella todos los fines de semana viaja a la zona de Luque, Mariano  Roque Alonso y otros a ofrecer sus productos que consisten en frazadas,colchas y hamacas,  y también ropas , zapatos y todo lo que su clientela le pida, sin importar las condiciones del tiempo ella realiza  este trabajo ya que es el sustento de su familia.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de todo tipo, ya que quiere cumplir con algunos de los pedidos de sus clientes. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo que le es de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The community group "San Cayetano" is made up of 15 entrepreneurial women and is in its sixth business cycle. All the group members are responsible, hardworking women who are grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity to provide for their families and make an honest living.

Felipa is a member of the group and is 62 years old. She travels all around selling a wide variety of products, including blankets, sheets, hammocks, clothing, shoes, and anything her customers request. On weekends she travels to the areas of Luque and Mariano Roque Alonso to sell her goods and hopefully generate income to provide for her family. 

With the support from this loan, Felipa plans to purchase clothing and other merchandise to stock her business. She hopes this investment will help her respond to client orders, and she is grateful for this incredible opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and other merchandise for resale at her business.

loans.name: Flor De Mandarina Sachina Uspantan Group

texts.es:
La señora Nicolasa es casada, cuenta con 26 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos y 3 de ellos estan estudiando, se dedica a la cosecha de cardamomo, inició este negocio cuando contrajo matrimonio y tuvo la necesidad de generar ingresos económicos para ayudar a su esposo con los gasros del hogar y hasta la fecha lleva 13 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la limpieza de su cosecha de cardamomo, espera en el furuto contar con mas cuerdas de terreno para poder sembrar mas cardamomo. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de cardamomo.
texts.en:
Nicolasa, 26, is married and has six children, three of whom are in school.  She wasn't able to attend school.

She makes a living growing cardamom.  She started this business when she got married and needed to generate income to help her husband with the household expenses.  She has 13 years of experience.

Nicolasa's organizing a group and requesting a loan to clear her cardamom crop.

She hopes to have more acreage of land in the future so she can plant more cardamom.  The other members of the group grow cardamom.

loans.use: to clear her cardamom crop

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 39-year-old, unmarried man from Ndunyu Njeru.

To earn a living, he provides maize-milling services, commonly referred to as "posho milling" in Kenya. He has been in this business for one year.

He has applied for his tenth loan from KADET ltd to enable him to buy new milling equipment. With the anticipated profits he expects to generate as a result of the loan, he plans to expand his business. In the near future, he hopes to apply for a larger loan to further expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase posho milling equipment

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 27 years old, married and blessed with one child aged one. 

She has a general shop in Ndunyu Njeru, which she has been running for the past year. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd, which will enable her to buy maize flour, rice and sugar, among others. With the anticipated profit, she plans to buy more stock of products for her business.

In the near future, Dorcas hopes to apply for a larger loan, to enable her to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice and sugar, among others

loans.name: Ruqaiyah

texts.en:
Ruqaiyah is a 57-year-old married woman. She is the mother of six sons and three daughters. Her sons work but do not generate stable income.

Ruqaiyah owns land which is very good for growing crops. She has been working on this plot of land (pictured) for fifteen years. The income she generates from selling crops help to cover her family's monthly expenses.

Ruqaiyah is seeking a loan from FATEN to help her buy seeds of different types of fruits and vegetables. She feels that the loan proceeds will help her to increase her family's income and to improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase seeds of different types of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 37-year-old man from Ndunyu Njeru. He is married to Leah, and they have four children, all of whom are in school.

For the past five years, he has been in the farming business.

After successfully repaying his prior loans, he is now applying for a third loan from Kadet Ltd. He intends to use the loan proceeds to buy a cow. With the profits he expects to generate as a result of the loan, he plans to pay for his children's school fees. In the near future, Joshua hopes to apply for a larger loan from KADET ltd to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 26 years old, married, and blessed with a five-year-old child.

She has a spare parts shop in Naivasha town which she has operated for five years. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd so she can buy spare parts to sell. She hopes to expand her business and also pay school fees with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, Tabitha hopes to own one of the biggest spare part shops in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Umara. He is married and has three children, aged four, eight and twelve. In 2000, Umara established his plastic products sales business.  The products he sells include bowls, cooking utensils, buckets, and spoons. He started the business in order to be self-reliant, after dropping out school. His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,497,250 every month from this business.

Umara would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. He has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and now he requires a new loan in order to buy additional goods to sell, including food flasks, plastic kettles and laundry bowls. He hopes that this loan can improve his stock and increase his profit. In the future, Umara plans to expand the business to the outskirts of town, and he hopes to be able to raise enough profit and further his education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell, including food flasks, plastic kettles and laundry bowls

loans.name: Sairakan

texts.ru: Сайракан 64 года, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Сайракан - среднее образование. Сайракан в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 43 года назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сайракан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, а также 22 головы мелкого рогатого скота, а также имеет земельный надел размером 4,0 ГА поливной земли, на которой она ежегодно выращивает софлер и фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сайракан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 1 коровы. Доходы от кредита Сайракан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Sairakan is a 64-year-old widow.  After her husband died she brought up three children by herself and managed her farm.  She has a high school education.  In order to bring in income for the family she raises livestock, having started out 43 years ago with the purchase of a cow for 2000KGS.   Thanks to her persistent hard work, Sairakan currently has a milk cow and 22 head of small livestock  on her farm.  She also has a 4-hectare plot of land on which she grows safflower and beans every year.  Her monthly income is 8000KGS.  

In order to further expand her farm, Sairakan has turned to the Bai Tushum and Partners microfinance bank for a loan of 50,000KGS to buy a cow to increase her herd.  She plans to use income from the loan to continue to grow the herd and to save up to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy cow.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 36 years old and married with one child who is in school.

She has a cereal shop in Naivasha which she has operated for three years. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy maize, beans, and finger millets, among other things. With the anticipated profit, she hopes to pay school fees and expand her business.

In the near future, she hopes to open a wholesale cereal shop in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, and finger millets, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shoes and and children's wear

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado las emprendedoras está en su ciclo numero quinto del programa de comité de mujeres de la fundación, donde cada una de ellas está dando su mayor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante.
Cirila es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de producto de limpieza, como ser desodorantes de ambiente, jabones, y demás. Por medio del trabajo que hace su familia está mejorando sus ingresos y están saliendo adelante.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos de limpieza, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas y mejorar los ingresos que tiene.
texts.en:
The community group, "Las Emprendedoras," (The Entrepreneurs) is in its fifth business cycle and is made up of hardworking women who are dedicated to providing for their loved ones and improving their quality of life.

One of the group members, Cirila, makes a living selling cleaning products, such as air fresheners, soap, detergents, etc. She works extremely hard at her job and leverages all her income to provide for her family.

With the support from this loan, Cirila plans to purchase cleaning products to stock her business. She hopes that this investment will help her to strengthen her business and increase her income and sales.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning products to stock her  business.

loans.name: Las Bellezas De Tarumandy Group

texts.es:
Las Bellezas de tarumandy es un grupo que está empezando con mucho entusiasmo a trabajar juntas y luchar por crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también como personas. Están ya en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras.
Marilina es la presidenta de este grupo, comenta que ella trata siempre de motivar a sus compañeras para poder seguir luchando y creciendo en el microemprendimiento de cada una. Ella es costurera y tiene muy buena clientela ya que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos. Solicita hoy esta ayuda para poder seguir con sus confecciones, ya que quiere comprar telas e hilos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que todas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
“Las Bellezas de Tarumandy” is a group that began with great enthusiasm so that they could work together to grow,  not just financially, but also personally.  They are in their second cycle of the program for women entrepreneurs.

Marilina is the group’s president and says that she always tries to motivate her fellow members to continue working and growing as small business owners.  She is a tailor and has steady customers because she does good work.  She is asking for help so she can continue making clothing.  She wants to buy fabric and thread.  She is grateful for the opportunity they have all gotten.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 46 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married and she was unable to go to school. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. 

For the past five years, Lydia has been selling door locks, hinges, nails, etc. from a table in the local market. She sells six days a week, from 8am to 5pm. She enjoys her business because of the flow of her customers and the profit she makes at the time. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. Most of the time, she uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her table.  

Lydia is requesting a loan to purchase door locks, hinges, nails, etc. for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She'd like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia Microfinance Company.

loans.use: to purchase door locks, hinges, nails, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is a 24-year old young man, newly married to Maureen, a business woman. He works in the motorcycle transport business in Narok town. He earns approximately KES 8,000 in a month.

He learned about KADET from other cyclist who has been funded by KADET Ltd. He has acquired an asset loan of 77,458 so he can purchase his own motorbike. This will enable him earn more income.

He will use the proceeds to repay his loan and re-establish his house. His wish is to have a successful family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for a transport business

loans.name: Balu

texts.en:
Balu a 43-year-old woman living in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She is married and has a 28-year-old child.

For the past two years, she has been operating a shop in her community where she sells lappa (fabrics). She received a little money from her husband to start her business, and she learned how to operate this business from her mother. She enjoys working because it allows her to generate income for her family's benefit.

She is now requesting a loan to purchase more lappa (fabric) for her business. In the future, she hopes to build a house. She thanks Kiva for supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase additional lappa (fabric) for her business.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is a single mother of four children between the ages of 23 and 13.  

She has a kiosk in Naivasha which she has operated for four years. After paying her previous loan well, she has applied for her third loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy potatoes and tomatoes, as well as to repair her kiosk. With the anticipated profit, she hopes to open a grocery shop.

In the near future, Petronila hopes to see her business stabilize and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, tomatoes, and to repair her kiosk.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married to a farmer; she has five children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses, as well as to save for a rainy day. 

A junior high school graduate, she currently sells soft drinks, cooked rice and stew in Kufur (near Cape Coast). With over 20 years of experience in this trade, Efua sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. 

Thus, her loan will be used to buy more soft drinks, rice, and other food items to help her boost her overall sales. 

Efua wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. Therefore, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her soft drink enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, rice, and other food items to help her boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is a widow and has one child. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Aba is a successful businesswoman. She sells smoked fish in Kufur (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for some years. As the sole bread-winner in the family, Aba uses her income to provide for the entire family.  

Aba will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of smoked fish, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of smoked fish, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира, 34 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывает 2 детей. Назира имеет средне-специальное образование. По специальности – медсестра. С 2007 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 25,000 сом KGS. Супруг и дети активно помогают по бизнесу. На сегодняшний день она смогла развить сельхоздеятельность. В хозяйстве у нее имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь и 10 овец, а также имеется 1,8 ГА поливной земли на которой она ежегодно выращивает картофель. В целях дальнейшего развития своего  хозяйства и полеводства Назира обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров с дальнейшим откормом и реализацией. Доходы от кредита Назира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота в своем хозяйстве, а также намерена накопить средства для обучения своих детей.
texts.en: Nazira is 34, married, and lives with her spouse and two children. She has a specialized high school degree in nursing. In 2007, Nazira started an agricultural business with 25,000 som. She raises livestock and plants crops, and currently has four milk cows, one horse, ten sheep, and 1.8 hectares of irrigated land that she uses to plant potatoes every year. The family is actively involved in helping Nazira around the farm. In order to expand her business, Nazira asked the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 135,000 som in order to buy cows, which she will fatten and resell for profit. With the income from this loan, Nazira plans to buy more cattle and to save money for her childrens' education.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is 48, from Ndunyu Njeru, and is married to Hannah.  She is also a farmer; they have two children who are in school.

Elias has been in the farming business for the past 18 years, and has applied for his third loan from Kadet Ltd after paying his previous loans well. He intends to use the loan to buy fertilizer and pay school fees. With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his farming business and also pay school fees.

Elias hopes to apply for a bigger loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him to venture into other businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay school fees.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 27 years old and not married. He has a pool table business which he has operated for one year and also sells phone accessories. He has applied for his fourth loan from Kadet ltd to enable him buy two pool tables and phone accessories. He hopes to expand his phone business with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, Henry hopes to have the biggest phone shop in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy pool tables and phone accessories.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 45 years old. She is not married and supports no one. She has been in the farming business for the past two years and has applied for her second loan from KADET after paying her previous loan well. She intends to use the loan to buy a cow. With anticipated profits, she plans to buy a heifer.

In the near future, Rose hopes to become the top farmer in her area.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Ñemity Group

texts.es:
Ñemity quiere decir “sembrar” en guaraní, el cual es la segunda lengua del Paraguay, ellas quieren significar que por medio de su grupo quieren sembrar la semilla del esfuerzo y trabajo, para que así puedan salir adelante.
Eva es una de las integrantes, quien hace comestibles de toda clase que ella misma elabora. Es una persona muy hábil en la cocina que está saliendo adelante por medio de su esfuerzo y también con la vasta ayuda de su familia. Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carnes, verduras, y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas que tanto gustan. Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que reciben.
texts.en:
Ñemity means "planting" in guaraní, which is the second language in Paraguay. They would like to show that through their group, they want to plant the seeds of effort and work, so that in this way they can get ahead.

Eva is one of the members, who makes food of all types that she constructs herself. She is a very skillful person in the kitchen who is getting ahead through her work and also with the vast help of her family. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of meats, vegetables and other inputs to be able to continue making her foods that are so well-liked. 

They are grateful to everyone for the opportunity they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables and other supplies.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a single mother of three children; all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has a business of selling biscuits, sweets, pans of bread, fried ground nuts and maize hard corns.  She has been in this business for a year.  

Sofia has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of sweets, biscuits, and fried ground nuts. She works at the market 7 days a week. Her major business challenges includes seasonality and KCCA tax collectors. 

She aspires to get a permanent business premise, and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of sweets, biscuits, and fried ground nuts.

loans.name: Mohamad Ahmad

texts.en:
Mohamad Ahmad is a 24-year-old single man who has worked as a car electrician for two years. He has short experience in this domain, but he has proven to be skilled in what he does. 

Mohamad Ahmad is working on expanding and developing his business, but he needs external financial support. So, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy the necessary electric car spare parts that will develop his business.  This will enable him to respond faster and more easily to the needs and requests from customers.

Mohamad Ahmad's shop is located on the international main road, which is a very important location to attract new customers.

He is planning to expand his business to start selling spare parts widely, in addition to his maintenance services.

loans.use: to buy necessary electric car spare parts

loans.name: Olga Lucía

texts.es: Olga es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 18 y 25 años de edad. Hace aproximadamente  6 años decidió montar su propio negocio, un almacén que ubicó en la sala de su casa, aprovechando que sus familiares, vecinos y amigos son sus principales clientes; de esta manera ha obtenido los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos de su hogar, pues toda la carga económica recayó sobre ella, luego de que el padre de sus hijos la abandonara. La cliente, con su espíritu emprendedor y con la motivación de sus hijos, pudo salir adelante, sobrepasando las adversidades. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el cual desea fortalecer su negocio, comprando más mercancía al por mayor (bolsos, perfumería, accesorios, cosméticos, cremas corporales y faciales, entre otros), con lo que podrá satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, ofreciendo más variedad de productos; esto dará como resultado el incremento en sus ventas y en sus ingresos. De esta manera, Olga desea continuar apoyando a sus hijos, brindándoles la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria para que tengan un futuro más próspero, además podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño, que es independizar su negocio de la vivienda, adquiriendo un local comercial más amplio, donde sus clientes puedan sentirse más cómodos y espera que esto le permita tener una mejor calidad de vida para disfrutarla al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Olga is a single mother of two children ages 18 and 25.  About 6 years ago, she decided to start her own business, a store located in a room in her home; her family, neighbors and friends are her best clients.  The store has allowed her to earn the necessary income to afford her household expenses, since she became the sole provider after the father of her children abandoned them.  

The client, with her enterprising spirit and her children as motivation, was able able to succeed and overcome adversity.  Currently, she is requesting a loan which she will use to strengthen her business by purchasing more wholesale merchandise (bags, perfumes, accessories, cosmetics, face and body lotions, etc...), with which she can satisfy the needs and desires of her clients by offering a wider variety of products.  This will increase her sales and revenue.  

With this, Olga hopes to continue to support her children, giving them the opportunity to have a college education so they may have a more prosperous future.  Additionally, she wishes to continue moving toward her principal dream which is to acquire a larger commercial space so she can move her business outside of her home, so her clients can feel more comfortable.  She hopes that this will allow her to improve her quality of life so she may enjoy it with her family.

loans.use: purchase wholesale merchandise (bags, perfume, accessories, cosmetics, face and body lotions, etc...)

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a single lady. She is 28 years old and supports three children between 2 and 6 years old. She sells both cereals and vegetables in Kabasis and has been in operation for a period of four years earning an income of 8,000 KES monthly.

This is her second loan of 35,000 KES from KADET LTD, and she wishes to use this amount to purchase maize, beans, and vegetables to resell. The profits she earns will be used to repay the loan.

Her dream is to succeed in her business and to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans, and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma  is married with three children; two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Fatuma has a business selling used clothes; she has been in this business for six years. She works in the market six days a week, and sells on a non- retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing price of used clothes.

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.    

She is aspires of becoming a wholesaler, and also to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 34 years old and not married. He is in the transportation business that he has operated for six years. He has applied for a third loan from Kadet ltd. to enable him buy sheep after paying his previous loan on time. With anticipated profit, he plans to buy more sheep.

In the near future, Joseph hopes to own a taxi.

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine, who is 38 years old, lives in the Senaki district with her husband, two school-age sons, and a retired mother. Ekaterine works as a cleaner at the local supermarket and gets a small monthly salary. The family runs a small-scale agricultural business and owns a vineyard and a plot of land where nuts are grown. They produce wine with the grapes and sell it locally.

As the existing income is not enough to cover food and everyday expenses, Ekaterine requested a loan from Credo to start up a dairy farm. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides for business start-ups and re-start-ups. It has credits with soft conditions for the country's vulnerable poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. 

With the received credit, Ekaterine will purchase a milk cow which she will house in an old, empty farm building located in the yard. Ekaterine will work hard on the farm and will sell milk in the village. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Their income will double, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to start a dairy farm

loans.name: Jestina M.

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Jestina, who lives in the West point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. A single woman attending a university, she has a seven-year-old child who lives at home and  attends school. 


Jestina is a hardworking woman who has been selling fashion slippers in the local market for the past seven years. She sells six days a week from 7 a.m.. to 5 p.m., using a shared taxi everyday to transport her slippers to her business spot. Jestina is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her enterprise. 

Her dream is to build a house for her children.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 29-year-old, single man. He has been working as a barber since twelve years ago. In May, 2012, he opened the present shop, and he is working hard to develop it to fit with his customers' needs and requests.

Abdallah is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to make necessary maintenance to his shop's chairs. He may use part of the loan to buy a new living room for his parents' house.

He is working hard to keep on developing his business in a well-managed way, and to keep on supporting his family's socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance to his shop's chairs

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en:
Eseza is married, with two children and one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents).
