She has a business of stone quarrying and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 300,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more hammers, axes, and hoes. She sells on a wholesale basis, six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Eseza is aspiring to acquire heavy machinery to assist in quarrying and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity, but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more hammers, axes, and hoes.

loans.name: Amanda De Jesús

texts.es: Amanda, con 62 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos. Toda su vida ha vivido en el campo, donde obtuvo los conocimientos necesarios sobre las labores agropecuarias, pues es la principal actividad económica en su región. Gracias a esto, hoy en día se dedica a comercializar pollos y huevos, actividad que realiza desde hace 12 años, ofreciendo los productos a familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector, de esta forma ha obtenido los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades y gastos de su familia. Amanda manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir luchando para cumplir sus objetivos, por el contrario, cada día se levanta más animada para realizar sus actividades con el deseo de poder ampliar sus galpones y aprovechar el terreno que tiene disponible, con lo que podrá comprar más gallinas y así aumentar sus ingresos, además es consciente que debe trabajar con esmero y dedicación para lograrlo. Esto la motiva para solicitar el crédito, que será invertido en la compra de concentrado para los animales, pues requiere engordar los pollos y alimentar sus gallinas ponedoras, así podrá continuar con su actividad e incrementar la entrada de recursos económicos.  Amanda desea tener muchos años más de salud y vida, pues siente que todavía le faltan muchas cosas por hacer y sueños por realizar, por el momento desea poder disfrutar de mejores condiciones de vida y una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en:
Amanda is 62 years old and is the single mother of three children.  She has lived on the farm all her life, where she learned what she needed to know about farm work, the main activity in her region.  Thanks to this, she sells chickens and eggs and has done so for 12 years, offering her products to relatives, friends, and residents in her area.  In this way she obtained the income she needed to pay her family expenses.

Amanda says that her age doesn’t impede her from working hard to achieve her objectives.  On the contrary, each day she awakes with even more enthusiasm to complete her activities, with the goal of expanding her chicken coups and taking advantage of the available land so she can buy more chickens and increase her income.  She also knows that she must work with care and dedication achieve this.  This motivated her to request this loan which she will use to buy concentrated feed for her animals.  She needs to fatten up her chickens and feed the hens so she can continue her activities and increase her financial resources.

Amanda wants to have many more healthy years and she feels that she still has many things to do in order to achieve her dreams.  She wants to be able to enjoy better life conditions and financial stability.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Carlos Miguel

texts.es: Carlos, con 35 años de edad, es soltero y aún no tiene hijos. Nació y creció en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas, pues es una tradición familiar. Desde que comenzó su vida productiva, se ha dedicado a laborar como jornalero en diferentes fincas del municipio donde reside, con lo cual ha obtenido experiencia y muchos conocimientos en el manejo de cultivos; gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de ñame y maíz, actividad que alterna con su empleo actual en una finca. Los cultivos están ubicados en un terreno de su propiedad que le quedó de una herencia familiar. Carlos es un hombre pujante, trabajador y activo, se esmera para lograr sus objetivos. Esto lo motiva a solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fertilizante, fungicidas, entre otros), que son necesarios para darle continuidad al cuidado de sus cultivos, esto le permitirá tener una cosecha con productos de mejor calidad, que podrán ser vendidos a un buen precio en el mercado, lo que se verá reflejado en el aumento de su producción y sus ingresos; adicionalmente le da más esperanzas de llegar a cumplir uno de sus principales sueños, que es ampliar sus cultivos para que le brinden una estabilidad económica favorable, ya que desea formar una familia en un futuro cercano y quisiera tener un negocio rentable y sostenible en el tiempo, para poder brindar buenas condiciones de vida a su futura familia.
texts.en:
Carlos, who is 35 years old, is single and does not have children. He was born and raised in the field, where he learned farming, which is a family tradition.

Since he began his working life, he has made his living working as a day laborer on different farms in the town where he lives. With this, he has obtained experience and a lot of knowledge in crop handling. Thanks to this, today he has crops of yams and corn, activities which alternates with his present employment at a farm.

The crops are located in land on his property which was given to him as a family heritage. Carlos is a strong, hard-working and active man who strives to reach his objectives. This motivates him to ask for the loan to invest in the purchase of agricultural inputs (composts, fertilizers, fungicides, and others) which are necessary to give continuity in the care of his crops. 

This will allow him to have a harvest with better quality products which will be able to be sold at a good price in the market, which will be reflected in the increase in his production and his income. 

Additionally, it will give him more hope of getting to meet one of his main dreams, which is to increase his crops so that they provide him with economic stability. He wishes to form a family in the near future and wants to have a business which is profitable and sustainable over time to be able to provide good living conditions to his future family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, such as compost, fertilizer, fungicide, and others.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 40 years old and single.

Josie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, chips, milk, coffee and spices.

Josie has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Josie aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, chips, milk, coffee and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (fabric, thread, buttons, elastic).

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos. Desde hace varios años inició su propio negocio, una fábrica de arepas, que se encuentra ubicada en la casa donde reside, esta idea surgió debido a la difícil situación económica por la que atravesaba su familia, aprovechando los conocimientos que obtuvo de su madre cuando era joven, así ha logrado generar los recursos para solventar las necesidades de su hogar. La cliente es trabajadora, activa, pujante y perseverante. Trabaja arduas jornadas para sacar una producción grande que le permita satisfacer la demanda actual que posee, pues sus principales clientes son propietarios de tiendas y restaurantes del corregimiento donde vive. 
El crédito que solicita, desea invertirlo en el arreglo del espacio donde tiene su negocio (cambiar el piso de arena, por cemento) y comprar insumos al por mayor (maíz, carbón), con esto tendrá la posibilidad de incrementar su producción y dará más confiabilidad a las personas que comprar su producto, pues el espacio tendrá una mejor imagen, favoreciendo el reconocimiento del negocio en el corregimiento donde reside. Elena sueña con tener una estabilidad económica más favorable, que le de la oportunidad de hacer crecer su negocio, brindar a sus hijos una mejor educación, pero especialmente, desea generar los ingresos suficientes para adquirir su casa propia en un futuro cercano, brindando a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Elena is 35 years old, married and a mother of 2 children.  Many years ago, she started her own business, an arepa factory in her home.  The idea came due to a difficult financial situation that her family found themselves in.  Taking advantage of the lessons her mother taught her at a young age, she has been able to generate the income to afford her household expenses.  She is hardworking, active, strong and persevering.  She works arduous days to generate a big output that will allow her to satisfy the demand.  Her main clients are store and restaurant owners of the township she lives in.  

She wishes to use the loan to repair the space in which she has her business (change the sand floor for a cement one) and purchase wholesale supplies (corn, charcoal), which will allow her to increase her production and give her clients more confidence in her products since the space will look nicer, improving its recognition in the town.  

Elena dreams of financial stability, having the opportunity to expand her business, providing her children with a better education, but she especially hopes to gain enough income to purchase her own home in the near future, giving her family a better life.

loans.use: complete on-site repairs (changing the floor) and purchase wholesale supplies (corn and charcoal)

loans.name: Lema

texts.en: Lema is 32 years old and married with four children. She wants to start a small business making and selling elei lavalava [a traditional Polynesian cloth worn as a skirt] in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy materials, brushes, paints and stencils. In the future, Lema hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, brushes, paints and stencils

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Please meet 33-year-old Noah, from Liberia. She lives at West Point, which has the most-populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has three children. She stopped her education at grade 6th, but two of her children are currently attending school. Her children are aged 10 months to 14 years.

She describes herself as a hardworking woman.  For the past ten years she has been operating a shop in the local market. She sells six days in a week, from 8am to 4pm. Noah likes earning money from her business. She learned how to sell from an older sister, and she started her business with money she had saved, over the year. She uses the bus most of the time, to transport her soft drinks,

Noah is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks to sell at her business. She plans to build a house and to educate all three of her children in the future. She would like to say "thanks," to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to sell at her business,

loans.name: Salamat

texts.ru: Саламат 52 года,  замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Саламат имеет средне-специальное образование. Соседи отзываются о ней как о старательной и ответственной женщине. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Семья очень дружная, отношения в семье очень хорошие. Саламат в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1994 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). Опыт в разведении и содержании скота очень большой. Благодаря упорному труду Саламат в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 20 овец, 2 нетели, 1 лошадь, а также имеет земельный надел размером 3,72 ГА, на которой выращивает фасоль и многолетние травы. Ее сельхоздеятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Саламат вырастить и обустроить детей, а также улучшить уровень жизни. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Саламат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Саламат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена накопить средства для оплаты обучения своих внуков в высших учебных заведениях.
texts.en:
Salamat is 52 years old, married and raising four children together with her husband. Salamat has specialized secondary education. The neighbors speak of her as a diligent and responsible woman. Her husband and children help her with her business. The family is very friendly, and their relationship is very good. 

As a main income for the family, Salamat has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation since 1994, after having started this business with 10,000 som (KGS). She has long experience with breeding and keeping livestock. Thanks to Salamat's persistent work, she currently has two dairy cows, 20 sheep, two heifers and one horse on her farm. She also has a plot of land of 3.72 hectares, on which she grows beans and perennial grasses. Her agricultural business brings in around 10,000 som (KGS) per month, which is the basis for covering the family's food and household expenses. The income from the farm has allowed Salamat to raise and equip the children, and also to improve their living standard.

With an aim to further develop her business, Salamat turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cows. Salamat plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business, and also, she intends to save up money to, in the future, pay for higher education for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 23-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has no children.

In 2009, Fatmata established her home products sales business, where she sells various provisions, drinks and toiletries to her customers. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant. Her business is located in the outskirts of town and her customers are of all ages. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns approximately 500,000 SLL every month from her business. She is proud of the fact that she started her business in a stall and now has a shop.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to pay for additional products such as laundry soaps, ovaltine, and sugar. She hopes that this loan can help her increase her inventory and profits. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand the business and to sell re-chargeable cards; more generally, she hopes to generate additional profits and to further her education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional products (e.g., laundry soaps, ovaltine, and sugar)

loans.name: Sia

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Sia. She is a widow and has three children. Her children are seven, fifteen and twenty-one years old. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her and helps with chores around the house.

In 2008, Sia started a food production business. She started the business after losing her husband so that she could be self-reliant. Her business is located in a city center and her main customers are adults. By working 6 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns approximately 900,000 SLL every month from her business.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to pay for additional ingredients such as bags of rice, onions, and palm oil. She hopes that this loan can help her increase her inventory and improve the business. In the future, Sia plans to transform the business into a restaurant and hopes to generate sufficient profits to pay for her children's educational needs. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients (e.g., rice, onions, and palm oil)

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 30 years old, married, and blessed with four children aged 14 years, 11 years, 7 years, and 14 months.

She has a money transfer business (M-pesa) in Naivasha town which she has operated for six years. She has applied for a second loan from Kadet ltd to enable her buy M-pesa float and calling cards. She plans to pay school fees with anticipated profit.

In the near future, Ruth hopes to become to be an established money-transfer expert in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy M-pesa float and calling cards.

loans.name: Helina's Group

texts.en:
Helina, who is in her early forties, is single with two children. The children are 15 and 10 respectively. For six years now, Helina has had this enterprise: a cooking oil business, selling door to door and supply as well. She runs this business for eight hours only (8 a.m. to 5 p.m.). In this time, Helina is able to earn a fair profit per month. 

This will be her sixth loan request from ID-Ghana, which she will use to buy one barrel of palm oil and supply to customers. With the previous loans, all of which she repaid back successfully, she managed to increase her business stock. The business profit was used to for reinvestment and savings toward her children's education and covered home expenses. Helina dreams that one day she will able to own a guesthouse. 

She together with other two members are requesting a total loan amount of GHS 1800 to improve businesses.

loans.use: To buy one barrel of palm oil and supply to customers.

loans.name: Tajy Punta Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Tajy Punta  está en su ciclo 7º del programa de comité de mujeres, todas ellas son conscientes que deben trabajar duro para poder salir adelante y dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nilda, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total, ya que con ello podrá dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que vende comidas de todo tipo, como ser minutas: empanadas, sándwich y demás y con esto lucha por dar de todo a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carnes, condimentos, especias y demás y con esto seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que hace.
texts.en:
The group called Tajy Punta is its seventh cycle of the program of the women's committee. All of the women are conscious that they should work hard to be able to get ahead and give their families everything they weren't able to have.

One of the members is Nilda. Through her effort and continuous work, and the application of vital behaviors of a successful woman, her situation is improving, but she is equally conscious that this work and effort that she is making should be continuous and permanent to achieve a total success, with which she will be able to give better welfare to her family.

Among the work that she does, she sells foods of all kinds, such as empanadas, sandwiches and more. With this she struggles to provide everything for her family.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of vegetables, meats, condiments, spices and more and with this, to continue delighting her customers with the delights she makes.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, condiments, spices and more.

loans.name: Matauaina

texts.en:
Matauaina is a 31-year-old woman who is married with four children. She has a small business of a vegetable garden. To earn extra income, she also has an elei printing business. 
Matauaina needs a loan to buy fertilizer, vegetable seeds, a garden fork, a garden hose, a sewing machine, color paints, brushes, stencils and elei board design. She will use her profits to support her family financially. Matauaina joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, vegetable seeds, a garden fork, a garden hose, a sewing machine, color paints, brushes, stencils and elei board design for printing.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Мохире 32 года. Она разведена и имеет 3 не совершеннолетних детей. Мохира начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды после того, как она прошла курс «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Данное время она введет успешно свой бизнес и у нее много клиентов. Мохира постепенно накапливает деньги и улучшает уровень проживания для своих детей. Она хочет провести церемонию обрезания своего сына, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для проведения этого мероприятия. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Mohira is 32 years old. She is divorced and has three children, who are not yet adults. Mohira started her business of sewing women's clothing after having attended the course "To Get Ahead" organized by the Association of Business Women. Currently Mohira manages her business successfully and she has many customers.

Mohira gradually saves money and improves the living standard for her children. She would like to hold a circumcision ceremony for her son, but does not have the money. She requests a loan in the amount of 4,000 somoni for holding this event. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To hold a circumcision ceremony for her son

loans.name: Surayo

texts.ru: Сурайё 42-летняя разведенная женщина. Она со своими пятерьмя детьми проживает в районе Яван. Старший сын находится на заработках за пределами страны, старшая дочь работает в дилерском центре, а остальные дети еще учатся. Сурайё в данное время нигде не работает. Она собирается начать торговый бизнес. Сурайё приобрела столик и хочет около дома торговать продуктами. Ее стартовый капитал составляет 300 TJS. Она просит кредит, чтобы закупить товар. На сумму кредита и сбережения она хочет приобрести печенье, шоколад, вафли и другие продукты. Она нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Surayo is a 42 year-old, divorced woman.  She and her five children live in the Yavan district.  Her oldest son works abroad, oldest daughter works at a dealer center, and the rest of the children still study.  At the present time, Surayo does not work anywhere.  She is planning to start a retail business.  Surayo purchased a table and wants to sell food products near her house.  Her initial capital amounts to 300 TJS.  She is requesting this loan to purchase products.  She wants to use this loan to buy cookies, chocolate, waffles and other products.  She needs your support.

loans.use: to buy cookies, chocolate, waffles and other products to start a retail business

loans.name: Sainat

texts.ru: Сайнат 59 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Сайнат - среднее образование. Сайнат в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сайнат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 3 овцы и 7 коз, ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сайнат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки мелкого рогатого скота. Доходы от кредита Сайнат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Sainat is 59 years old and a widow. After the death of her husband she is raising three children herself, and also managing her business. Sainat has secondary education. 

As a main income for her family, Sainat works with livestock breeding, after having started this business eight years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Sainat's persistent work, her farm currently consists of two dairy cows, three sheep and seven goats, and the monthly income is 4,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Sainat turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) for increasing the number of livestock through purchasing sheep. Sainat plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, and also plans to save money for repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase wholesale supplies (fabrics, threads, buttons, elastic)

loans.name: María Luceny

texts.es: María a sus 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Hace 8 años inició su propio negocio, una cafetería ubicada en un acopio de taxis y busetas del sector donde reside; esta idea surgió de la necesidad de generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con el sustento del hogar, pues han pasado por situaciones precarias debido a que su esposo es agricultor y sus ingresos son muy inestables, pues es una actividad económica muy incierta. María labora arduas jornadas de Lunes a Domingo desde las 6:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm, aprovechando al máximo el tiempo en el que se presenta mayor flujo de personas, que pueden llegar a ser clientes potenciales. La cliente es una mujer luchadora, dedicada a buscar el bienestar para su familia, amable y servicial, cualidades que le han permitido posicionar su negocio. Se motiva para solicitar el apoyo del crédito, ya que desea comprar surtido al por mayor (gaseosas, mecato, confitería, empanadas, papas rellenas, entre otros) y realizar unas mejoras en el local, además cancelará el saldo que tiene vigente; esto le permitirá darle una mejor imagen a su negocio, cambiando la percepción de los transeúntes, incitándolos a comprar, además tendrá más variedad de alimentos para ofrecer y así satisfacer los gustos de sus comensales. Todo esto se verá reflejado en el incremento de las ventas y por ende, sus ingresos, con los cuales podrá estabilizar la economía del hogar y brindar un mejor bienestar a su familia. María sueña con montar otro negocio en un sector más comercial, que le brinde la oportunidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida y generar empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old and is married with four children. Eight years ago she started up a cafe near the local bus and taxi terminal because she needed to generate income to help support her family. As a farmer, María's husband has an unstable income and is at the mercy of market forces and potentially destructive weather patterns. María works seven days a week from 6:00 in the morning until 9:00 in the evening at her cafe, since she needs to take advantage of hours when the greatest number of travelers are passing through the terminal. María is a hardworking and kind woman who is devoted to her family and her business.

With the support from this loan, María plans to purchase merchandise to stock her cafe, including soft drinks, candy, empanadas, stuffed potatoes and other food items. She also hopes to make some improvements to her actual store to make it more appealing to travelers and potential clients. She hopes that this investment will allow her to offer a wider variety of food items to her customers and will strengthen her business so that she can improve her family's quality of life. María's dream is to start up another business in a more commercial sector where she can grow and expand the business to provide employment and opportunity for others.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her cafe (soft drinks, candy, empanadas, stuffed potatoes, etc.), as well as to make some improvements to her actual store to make it more appealing to travelers and potential clients.

loans.name: Lilita

texts.en:
Lilita is widowed with 10 children. She is 63 years old and lives in Masabod, Clarin, Philippines. Lilita is a farmer and grows vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers.
Lilita has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Lilita hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is married with one child. Perla is 46 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Perla sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 40,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

Perla has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Perla hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is married with five children and four of her children go to school. She has a business of making bricks and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more firewood for burning bricks. She works from home and sells on wholesale only. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of investing in used clothes and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for burning bricks.

loans.name: Sanea

texts.en:
Sanea is 30 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is unmarried, and she was unable to go to school. She described herself as a hardworking woman. Over the past six years, she has been selling pepper cala (dough) in the local market. She sells six days in a week from 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her, and she started this business by selling cold water. She uses a shared taxi every time to buy her goods.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, pepper, vita, coal, etc., for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, pepper, vita, coal, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 28 years old. He is married with three children and they all go to school. With the loan, Alphonse would like to request a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers for use during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the growing of more rice for the better returns and more future opportunities.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production.

loans.name: Bakhtygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул, 48 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывает 4 детей. С 1987 года занимается пошивом национальной одежды для населения, а также шьет приданое на заказ девушкам на выданье. Бизнес очень хороший, а самое главное Бактыгул с удовольствием занимается своей работой-шитьем, которое приносит ей ежемесячный доход в сумме 20,000 сом KGS. Несмотря на понесенный ущерб бизнесу во время волнений в 2010 году, Бактыгул смогла выстоять и дальше развить свою деятельность. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в  микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом(KGS)  на закуп материалов, таких как: ткани, фурнитура, пуговицы и т.д.. На доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует увеличить объем заказов на приданное и открыть свой личный цех.
texts.en: Bakhtygul is 48 years old, married and raising four children together with her husband.  She has been involved in sewing national clothing for residents since 1987 and also sews dowry to-order for brides-to-be.  The business is very good, and the main thing is that Bakhtygul does her sewing work, that yields her a monthly income in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS), with satisfaction.  Despite the business losses during the instability in 2010, Bakhtygul was able to withstand and further develop her business.  In order to continue developing her business, Bakhtygul requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy materials, such as fabrics, sewing accessories, buttons, etc.  She plans to use the earnings from the loan to increase the number of dowry orders and open her own sewing factory.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as fabrics, sewing accessories, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a single mother of five children, and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She has a business of a beauty salon and has been in this business for eight years. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids. She generates additional income through selling soda and juices. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges includes seasonality, and on-and-off electricity and piped water. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked beauty salon and also to educate her children up to university.  

She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en: Japhet lives in Mombasa Kenya where he runs a retail shop. He is 35 years old, married, and has two children aged four and two. The retail shop has been in operation for the last year. He also sells charcoal to complement the business. He has a vision of opening more branches of the business in the next five years. He knew Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy sugar, cooking fat, and rice for sale. The extra income that will be raised from the business will improve his living standards and help him take his children to school.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fat, and rice

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan; she is a past member of BRAC and is taking a new loan after two years. Two years ago she took a loan and purchased an auto rickshaw for her husband, with the contribution of her savings. Now, the body of the rickshaw has depreciated due to the stress of driving on under-constructed roads. His daily income goes to household expenses and he does not have savings to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Asia has again contacted Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan and described her financial problem. The field staff checked out her past good behavior and has given approval for the new loan. Asia seems very grateful after this honorable act and says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To repair the rickshaw body

loans.name: Koshi

texts.fr:
Koshi est âgée de  43 ans. Pendant 8 ans, elle a vendu des condiments qu’elle achetait à crédit. A cause du délai très court de remboursement auquel elle devait faire face, elle était souvent confrontée aux problèmes de remboursement. Pour y faire face, elle s’est donc aussi lancée dans la vente de volailles.
Grâce au crédit sollicité, Koshi pourra acheter les produits au comptant et avoir une marge bénéficiaire plus grande, avec un délai raisonnable pour rembourser. 
Les conseils et les formations dont elle bénéficie déjà grâce à Assilassimé lui ont appris à mieux gérer son acticité : elle est en bonne voie vers l’autonomie !
texts.en:
Koshi is 43 years old. For 8 years, she sold spices which she purchased on credit. Because of the very short time frame in which she had to repay the credit, she was often faced with repayment problems. She therefore also began selling poultry in order to manage.

With the loan proceeds being requested, Koshi will be able to purchase products in cash and be able to retain a larger profit margin, with a more reasonable repayment time. The advice and training that she has already received thanks to Assilassimé has helped her manage her business better : she is on her way towards self-sufficiency!

loans.use: purchase two baskets of tomatoes and 5 baskets of vegetables

loans.name: Akoessiwa

texts.fr:
Akoessiwa vit à Bè non loin de la plage de Lomé. Agée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle vendait des crèmes pour la peau,  mais s’est reconvertie en 2007 dans le commerce de vêtements de seconde main et de l’huile végétale par manque d’argent.
Grâce au crédit sollicité, elle pourra augmenter  la quantité de produits achetés et payer la totalité au comptant. Ceci lui permettra de dégager plus de profit : elle pourra subvenir aux besoins de la famille et notamment financer la scolarité de son enfant, étant donné qu’elle est la seule personne ayant une source de revenu dans le foyer.
texts.en:
Akoessiwa lives in Bè not far from the Lomé beach. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She used to sell skin creams, but switched into second hand clothing and vegetable oil business due to lack of funds.

With the requested loan proceeds, Akoessiwa will be able to increase the quantity of products she purchases and be able to pay entirely in cash. This will allow her to earn more profit; she will then be able to provide for the needs of her family and specifically to finance the education of her child, since she is the only one in her home with a source of income.

loans.use: purchase 200 sets of clothing

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида молодая и энергичная женщина. Ей 24 года. Она несчастлива, так как судьба отняла у нее любимого мужа. Она вдова и имеет 2 не совершеннолетних детей. Фарида более 4 года работает учительницей в средней школе. Она преподает младшим классам. Фарида является одной из успешных учителей школы. Она параллельно учится в Педагогическом Университете Таджикистана по специальности узбекская филология. Фарида живет с родителями и сестрами и братьями. В семье их 8 человек. Скоро у них в семье сыграют свадьбу, и Фарида хочет помочь своим родителям. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Farida is a young and energetic woman.  She is 24 years old.  She is unlucky because fate took away her beloved husband.  She is a widow and has two adolescent children.  Farida has been working as a teacher at a secondary school for over 4 years.  She teaches younger grades.  Farida is one of the most successful teachers at the school.  She concurrently studies Uzbek philology at the Tajikistan Pedagogical University.  Farida lives with her parents, sisters and brothers.  There are 8 people in their family.  A wedding is being planned to be held soon in her family, and Farida wants to help her parents.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to hold a wedding celebration.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to hold a wedding celebration

loans.name: Liberathe

texts.en:
Liberathe is 42 years old. She is married with six children, who are between 5 and 21 years old. With a Kiva loan, she would to buy more fertilizer for use during rice production. The profits from the harvest will be used to provide for her family's basic needs for a better future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during rice production

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 43 years old. He is married, with three children who all go to school. He has been in the rice growing for the past 27 years. With a Kiva loan, Emmanuel would like to buy more fertilizer for use during rice production. The profits from the harvest will be used to pay for his children's school fees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during rice production

loans.name: Cristina Yamileth

texts.es:
Cristina cuenta con 31 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos; un niño de 5 años que estudia y una niña recién nacida de tan solo 3 meses de vida. Ella se dedica a prestar sus servicios como domestica aparte de eso, también destaza cerdos. El esposo se dedica a prestar sus servicios como jornalero, en la comunidad.

Desde hace 15 años trabajara como domestica, para llegar a su lugar de trabajo debe abordar el primer bus a las 6 de la mañana, se desplaza una distancia más o menos de 30 km, en horarios de lunes a jueves, los demás días se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y destazo de cerdos actividad que desempeña hace mas de 10 años. 


El crédito que solicita, es para comprar cerdos,concentrado para engordarlos ya sea para venderlos o para destazarlos ellos mismos, obteniendo mayores ingresos, asegurando una mayor entrada económica y podrán cancelar el crédito con la institución. 
  
Su proyecto es instalar una porqueriza, para mantener la crianza de cerdos, a demás de tener planes de reconstruir la vivienda donde viven actualmente y sueña con ver a sus hijos graduados y con trabajos estables.
texts.en:
Cristina is 31 years old and she lives with her two children; a five-year-old boy who is in school and a newborn girl who is only three months old.  She works as a housekeeper for a living and she also butchers pigs.  Her husband works as a laborer in the community.  

She has been a housekeeper for 15 years.  To get to her workplace she has to catch the first bus at six in the morning, which takes her around 30 km, from Monday to Thursday.  On the other days, she works raising and butchering pigs, which she has been doing for 10 years.  

The loan she is requesting is to buy pigs and feed to fatten them so they can either sell them or butcher them themselves.  This will provide them with more profits, which will give them a good financial start, and which will allow them to repay their debt to the institution.  

She has a plan to build a pigpen to care for the pigs she is raising.  She also has plans to rebuild the home they currently live in and she dreams of seeing her children graduate and get stable jobs.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed to fatten them

loans.name: Pélagie

texts.fr:
Pélagie, célibataire, est âgée de 26 ans. Elle habite dans le quartier de Gabara Kondji, à Lomé. Elle est coiffeuse, fait des tresses et s’est lancé dans le commerce de produits de beauté en 2011. Elle exerce également l’activité de pédicure et manucure, mais de façon ambulante car elle ne dispose pas d’assez de moyens pour payer les frais de bail d’un atelier. 
Le crédit sollicité lui permettra d’acheter le matériel nécessaire pour exercer cette activité, ce qui attirera davantage de clientèle dans sa boutique.
texts.en:
Pélagie is unmarried and 26 years old. She lives in the Gabara Kondji neighborhood in Lomé. She is a hairdresser who makes braids and began a beauty products business in 2011.

Pélagie also offers manicures and pedicures, but in door-to-door fashion since she does not have the means to pay for rent on a shop. The loan proceeds being requested will allow her to buy the necessary supplies for this work, which will increase the number of customers for her business.

loans.use: purchase 30 hair extensions and 5 boxes of hair straightener

loans.name: Eva Herlinda

texts.es: Eva es una señora humilde de muy buenos valores quien trabaja muy duro para salir adelante. Ella posee una tienda en su casa de habitación donde comercializa productos perecederos como: granos básicos, bebidas y golosinas. Así mismo comercializa productos de catálogo y trabaja como peluquera, dedicándose a diversas actividades para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Eva vive junto a su esposo y su madre de  82 años de edad quien depende por completo de ella. Actualmente en su casa de habitación, Eva tiene un cerco de alambres para resguardar su casa, pero debido a la delincuencia del lugar ella desea construir un muro conocido como tapial con ladrillo de barro, por lo que solicita un préstamo a FUSAI para contar con el dinero necesario para realizar la compra de todos los materiales necesario para elaborar el muro y de este modo tener un hogar mejor resguardado y seguro.
texts.en: Eva is a humble woman with strong values who works very hard to get ahead.  She has a store in her home where she sells perishable products, such as staple grains, drinks, and candy.  She also sells products via catalog and she works as a hairdresser.  She does theses different kinds of work to help her husband with the household expenses.  Eva lives with her husband and her 82-year-old mother who is completely dependent upon her.  Eva currently has a chain-link fence around her house for security, but because of crime in the area she wants to build a strong wall out of brick.  She is asking FUSAI for a loan so she will have the money she needs to buy all the materials required to build the wall so her home will be better protected and secure.

loans.use: to buy the materials to build a wall around her house

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 50 years old and single. She works very hard to support her parents and nephews.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more grocery products to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, eggs and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is married and works hard to support her family. For the past five years she has had a food production "piaya making" business in the Philippines.

Phoebe is applying for a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. She wants to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 43 years old and lives in West Point, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married with five children, aged between 10 and 20. Three of her kids go to school and live at home. She did not attend school, but she is a businesswoman with potential who manages her business well to enable her to support her home. Her husband is a businessman as well. 

Over the past 10 years Esther has been running a table in the local market without facing any serious problems. This business started with a small amount of money she got from her husband. She sells fish six days a week, spending 10 hours a day in her business. 

Esther is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more. She thanks BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru: Елена добросовестная и душевно богатая женщина. Она единственная надежда своих детей. Она хранительница очага своего дома. Ее муж умер несколько лет назад, и ей было очень трудно справляться с семейными расходами. Она более 1 года работает в Отделе Внутренних Дел как уборщица. Елена качественно выполняет свою работу, так как она трудолюбивая и чистоплотная женщина. Елена воспитывает 2 детей. Ее дети Парвина и Далер. Елена уже давно планирует отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет денег. Она хочет отремонтировать все комнаты и заменить окна. Елена запрашивает займ на сумму 4800 сомони для покупки цемент, шпаклевки, окна и двери. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Elena is a conscientious and spiritually rich woman.  She is the only hope for her children.  She is the protector of her home and hearth.  Elena's husband passed away a few years ago and it was very difficult for her to cope with the family's expenses.  For more than a year, she has been working as a cleaner at the Department of Internal Affairs.  She does quality work, as she is a hard-working and orderly woman.  Elena is raising two children, Parvina and Daler.  For a long time, she has been planning to make repairs to her home, but she doesn't have enough money.  She wants to repair all the rooms and to replace the windows.  Elena is asking for a loan of 4,800 somoni to buy cement, putty, windows and doors.  She is awaiting your kindness and counting on your charity.

loans.use: To buy cement, windows, doors, etc. to make repairs on her house.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr:
Ayélé, 38 ans, est mariée et n’a pas encore d’enfant. Elle habite dans le quartier de Gabara Kondji, à Lomé. Ayélé a vendu des pagnes pendant  10 ans, mais le vol de ses marchandises l’a contraint à rester sans activité pendant deux ans. 
Elle se lance ensuite dans le commerce de petits poissons, dont les ménages de son quartier sont de grands consommateurs ! 
Ayélé sollicite ce crédit pour avoir un stock plus conséquent, éviter les ruptures de stocks et pouvoir faire face à la demande croissante de ses clients.
texts.en:
Ayélé, 38 years old, is married and does not yet have any children. She lives in the Gabara Kondji neighborhood in Lomé. Ayélé sold cloth for 10 years, but the theft of her merchandise forced her to postpone her business for two years.

Ayélé is now restarting a business, this time in small fish, of which the households in her neighborhood are big consumers! She is requesting this loan to have a larger stock, avoid running out of stock, and being able to meet the growing requests of her customers.

loans.use: purchase 6 batches of small fish

loans.name: Samsad's Group

texts.en:
Samsad’s husband is a very old person, but fully professional in his art. He creates different designs on wooden beds which are very famous in his hometown. Samsad is a very poor lady; this is the reason she could not provide education to her any kids. She is the mother of five sons and a daughter; her daughter got married.

Her one son helps his father in manufacturing wooden tables and chairs. All of her family members are doing jobs to meet their daily expenses and household expenses. Due to a lot of daily expenses, her husband is unable to buy new inventory to carry on his business. Therefore, Samsad requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy casual inventories to carry on his enterprise. 

Samsad has grown old and does not see any resources in old age. It is her dream to pass her life with peace and joys; she hopes that through the profit amount, she will able to increase her savings to feed herself in old age.

loans.use: to buy raw material for making furniture, such as tables and chairs, to sell.

loans.name: Samuel Antonio

texts.es:
Samuel tiene 20 años de edad, se dedica a prestar sus servicios como jornalero, a la crianza de cerdos, estas actividades las desempeña desde los 15 años, las aprendió de su difunto padre; hasta el momento son 5 años desempeñando dichas actividades laborales, el trabaja en la zona y recorre 5km de distancia al lugar de trabajo, su horario de trabajo es de 6 de la mañana hasta las 12 del día, el resto del día lo trabaja en la crianza de los cerdos.

Él  termino sus estudios de bachillerato, y reside con su familia la cual la conforman sus 3 hermanos su madre y padrastro.

El crédito lo solicita para comprar más cerdos, debido a que es la actividad fuerte para él, le genera mayores entradas de dinero a corto plazo, y el resto del dinero lo invertirá en la reparación del automóvil.

Samuel, sueña con adquirir su propio terreno, para construir su vivienda, además desea ahorrar cierta cantidad para los gastos familiares que podría tener en un futuro cercano. Además sueña con brindarle el estudia a su hermana menor y verla como un profesional.
texts.en:
Samuel is 20 years old and works as a laborer, raising pigs.  He has been doing this since he was 15 and learned from his deceased father.   He’s been doing this work for the past five years and he works five km from his home, working from 6:00 am to 12:00 pm.  He spends the rest of the day tending to his own pigs.

He completed his bachelor studies and lives with his family, made up of three brothers, his mother, and father in law.

He is asking for this loan to buy more pigs, since this is a strong business for him and it generates good money in a short time.  He will use the rest of the money to repair his car.

Samuel wants to have his own land on which he can build his house.  He also wants to save some for the family expenses he may have in the near future and also provide an education for his younger sister and see her become a professional.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Phuong was born in 1989. She has two children aged 4 and 2. Her husband is a construction worker and he earns about 4,500,000 VND per month. Phuong sells beverages to earn a living. She earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for three years. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,500,000 VND per month. Her challenges in life and work include lacking capital to invest in her beverage stall and caring for her children that are still little. Her dream is that her children will learn more and her business will get easier. This loan is one step that can help her achieve this dream. 

Phuong is a hardworking and dynamic woman. She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2011. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to invest in her beverage stall. She always wants to expand the scale of her business and raise her children well.

Other members which are part of Phuong's group include the following: 
Ly is 28 years old. She has two children. She is a carpentry helper. She wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND to invest in her business.
Sinh is 27 years old. She has two children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND to invest in her carpentry. 
Loan is 53 years old. She has one child. She sells pork in the market. She wants to borrow 10,976,000 VND to invest in her business. 
Lien is 29 years old. She has two children. She is a carpentry helper. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to invest in her work.

loans.use: to invest in her beverage stall.

loans.name: Berfalia

texts.es: Berfalia vive en una comunidad muy humilde junto a su esposo y cinco hijos, de los cuales los dos mayores trabajan. Berfalia trabaja muy duro para ayudarle  a su esposo y contar con una vida más estable, es por esto que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas y así mismo trabaja como empleada doméstica al igual que su hija mayor. Esta es una familia muy unida en donde todos ponen de su parte para salir adelante. Berfalia solicita un préstamo para poder contar con el dinero necesario para instalar luz eléctrica en su casa de habitación, ya que nunca ha podido tenerla, y ahora con dicho préstamo podrá suplir esta necesidad básica. Así mismo invertirá en mejorar el techo de su casa. Con esto Berfalia y su familia podrán contar con este servicio básico para realizar sus actividades diarias por la noche con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
Berfalia lives in a very humble community alongside her husband and five children; the oldest two work. Berfalia works very hard to help her husband and to have a more stable life. It's for this that she makes her living making and selling tortillas and also works as a domestic employee like her older sister. This is a very united family where everyone puts forth his or her part to get ahead.

Berfalia is asking for a loan to be able to come up with the necessary money to install electricity in her house. She has never been able to have it and now with the said loan she will be able to supply this basic necessity. Likewise, she will invest in improving the roof of her house. With this, Berfalia and her family will be able to have this basic service in order to carry out their daily activities at night more easily.

loans.use: to install electric lights in her home.

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en:
Pascasie, a 56-year-old married mother of three children who are between 21 and 24 years, has been growing rice for 20 years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers for use in rice growing. The profits from the business will help to provide food for the family and other basic necessities for a better future.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production

loans.name: Francess

texts.en:
Francess is 27 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single, and has a 13-year-old child who is presently in school and lives at home. She completed 12th grade before starting her business. She described herself as a hardworking woman.  

For the past two years, she has been selling tea and bread in a shop around the local market, and she sells six days in a week from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. She likes her business because it is a fast-going business. She started this business by selling bread. She uses a taxi to buy her stock. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more over-tea, bread, sugar, milk, etc., for her business. She plans to build a house and attend a university.
  
She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more tea, bread, sugar, milk, etc., for her business,

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 48-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her family. Her husband has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. Her husband also assists his younger brother by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health expenses.

Nazia wants to grow the business of her husband, so she requested a loan from Kiva's field partner's BRAC Pakistan so that her husband could buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits.

loans.name: Murod

texts.ru: Мурод житель района Дж.Руми. Ему 51 год. Он является сотрудником водоканала. У него жена и четверо детей. Мурод решил заняться собственным семейным бизнесом, чтобы получать хорошую прибыль, так как его зарплата не хватает на нужды семьи. Он собирается открыть бизнес по откорму и продаже крупнорогатого скота и будет совмещать его со своей основной работой. Ему будут помогать жена и дети. Стартовый капитал Мурода составляет 670 таджикских сомони. Он просит кредит чтобы купить 4-х бычков и телят. Мурод планирует каждый месяц закупать по 4-х голов скота и после 30 дней откорма продавать на местном скотном рынке по прибыльной цене. Полученный доход он хочет использовать для проведения свадьбы сына.
texts.en: Murod is 51 and a resident of the J. Rumy region. He works on the water canal and has a wife and four children. Murod has decided to work on his own family business so that he can earn more money, as his current salary does not cover his family's needs. He is preparing to start a business fattening and selling big-horned cattle, and will be dividing his time between this business and his main job with the help of his wife and children. Murod's starting capital amounts to 670 Tajik somoni, and he is requesting a loan to buy four steers and calves. Murod plans to buy about four head of cattle every month, and after 30 days of feeding will sell them at the local cattle market for a profitable price. The revenue he receives will be used to put on his son's wedding.

loans.use: To buy four steers and calves, in order to start a business and earn profits to pay for his son's wedding

loans.name: Kurbonby

texts.ru: Курбонби трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 47 лет. Она вдова и имеет 4 детей. Она более 3 лет занимается купле продажей продуктов питания на местном рынке. Курбонби заботливая мать и старается обеспечить своих детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Она старается развевать свой бизнес и получать больше дохода для того, чтобы получить больше дохода и создать благополучное условие жизни своим детям. Один из его сыновей болен и она должна срочно отвести его к врачу, но она не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для лечения своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Kurbonby is a hardworking woman. She is 47, a widow, and has four children. For more than three years she has worked buying and selling food products in the local market. Kurbonby is a caring mother and tries to provide her children with everything they need. She is trying to develop her business and achieve more revenue in order to receive more profits and create secure living conditions for her children. One of her sons is sick and she urgently needs to take him to the doctor, but she does not have the money. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 somoni for her son's treatment. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to pay for her son's medical treatment

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a Beninese artisan who specializes in hand-carved jewelry boxes and figurines. He would like to invest in the wood, metal plate, polish and paint that he uses in his sculptures and woodwork.

Ahmed has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is his story:

"After completing my elementary education, I became a self-taught woodcarver. My creations are basically both decorative and utilitarian. My materials come from our environment, and I use various types of wood and plate to form different designs. I feel proud to have shown my art in Germany, the US, South Africa and Namibia."

"The first microcredit I received helped me enormously. I believe my second loan will let me improve my work and make it even better. I therefore ask for Allah's blessing for all the good people out there who have helped with this funding. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Ahmed's hand-carved figurines and jewelry boxes on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6846

loans.use: to invest in the wood, metal plate, polish and paint that he uses in his sculptures and wood- work

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is widowed with six children. All of her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her mother). She has a business selling cosmetics and soap and has been in this business for 6 years. She has applied for a loan of 420,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of cream, relaxers, braids, toilet soap, and weaves. She works in a shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality, ever increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda, and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked cosmetics shop and also to educate her children up to the university level. She resides in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream, relaxers, weaves, braids, and toilet soap

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en:
Majeedan is age 42.  She has six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband renews and washes used and damaged carpets. He purchases carpets at scrap rates and, after renewing them, sells them at higher rates. Her husband does a lot of hard work for the sake of getting income each day. Her husband wants to buy carpets from a dealer who is selling used carpets in very good condition at cheap rates, but he does not have sufficient money to make a deal.

Majeedan requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to turn his business towards progress.  Majeedan hopes that this loan will improve the business of her husband positively, which impacts upon the income and savings as well.

Majeedan is very thankful to Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy used and damaged carpets for her husband to renew and then resell.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es una persona responsable y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y sus actividades económicas es trabajar para una empresa de mantenimiento de carreteras, él también se dedica a la agricultura, la ganadería, crianza de animales menores. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Su sueño es sacar profesionales a todos sus hijos.  

Mario nació en el distrito de Challabamba pero vive en la comunidad de Jajahuana. (Esta comunidad está ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Él tiene 57 años de edad, es casado y tiene diez hijos de la cual tres de sus hijos están a su lado pero los demás son independientes.
texts.en:
Mario is a responsible and hardworking individual who wants to help his family move forward.  His financial activities include his job at a highway maintenance company.  He also engages in farming and raising livestock and small animals.  Mario is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy small animals, such as guinea pigs and hens.  His dream is for all of his children to become professionals.  

Mario was born in the District of Challabamba, but now lives in the community of Jajahuana.  This community is located in the District of Challabamba in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco, Peru.  He is 57 years old, married, and has 10 children.  Three of his children still live with him while the others are independent.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 28 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has three children aged 3, 9, and 12. Her children attend school and live at home. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. 

Over the past three years she has been running a shop where she sells tea, bread, and fried eggs in the local market; she works 10 hours each day. Martha started this business with money given to her by mother. She uses a taxi to buy her goods. She like her business because of the popularity she has achieved over the years. 

Martha had requested a 20,000 LRD loan to purchase more Bear, Lipton tea, milk, eggs, over-tea, mayonnaise, butter, etc., for her business. She plans to build a house and become a big businesswoman. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more tea, milk, eggs, etc., for her business

loans.name: Muhsinjon

texts.ru: Мухсинджон умный и начитанный молодой человек. Ему 18 лет. Он не женат и живет в родительском доме. Мухсинджон в этом году успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет. Он поступил в факультет Финансы и кредит. В будущем он мечтает работать в банке. Мухсинджон в свободное время помогает отцу по домохозяйству и играет футбол. Он регулярно посещает библиотеку. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Muhsinjon is a smart and a well-read young man.  He is 18 years old, is not married, and lives with his parents.  This year, Muhsinjon finished high school and was accepted into the Tajik National University, where he enrolled into the department of Finance and Loans.  He dreams of, one day, working at a bank.  In his free time, Muhsinjon helps his father with housework, plays soccer and regularly attends the library.  He is asking for a loan to pay for his university tuition.  He is waiting for your kindness and is counting on your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for his education at the university

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in alpaca textiles. He needs to stock up on the alpaca wool he uses in his apparel and accessories.

Alfredo has been selling through NOVICA since 2001. This is his story:

"When I was but a small child I learned from my parents the best weaving techniques. Like me, they had learned from their own parents. This makes us a family entirely devoted to the world of textiles, and we have been for generations. Nowadays I combine knitting techniques, remaining true to Inca and colonial motifs."

"I want to express my greatest gratitude to all of you who are helping to fund this microcredit. Thank you so much for your faith in us. I send a warm, fraternal embrace to each and every one of you."

Use the link below to view Alfredo's alpaca apparel and accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2891

loans.use: to stock up on the alpaca wool he uses in his apparel and accessories

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es: Rufino vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de diez y doce años de edad quienes se dedican a estudiar. Rufino es un padre muy responsable y trabajador quien se esfuerza día con día para que a su familia no le haga falta lo necesario para vivir, él trabaja como vigilante en una empresa, este es un oficio muy riesgoso. Rufino solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para poder invertir en la compra de láminas para reparar el techo de un corredor de su casa, así mismo para poder comprar todos los materiales necesarios y mano de obra para mandar a ampliar su baño sanitario y también hacer más profunda la fosa de este, lo que brindará un ambiente más saludable y limpio a su familia. Rufino es una persona muy humilde quien su mayor prioridad es el bienestar de su familia, lo cual logrará gracias a este préstamo.
texts.en:
Rufino lives with his wife and their two children, ages ten and twelve years old, who are both students. He is a responsible and hard-working father who makes an effort every day to ensure his family does not lack for basic necessities. He works as a guard in a business, which is a very risky occupation.

Rufino is requesting this loan from FUSAI, which he will invest in the purchase of metal sheets to repair the roof of a corridor in his home. Additionally, he will purchase the materials and labor to expand his bathroom, making the septic tank deeper. This will provide a healthier, cleaner environment for his family.

Rufino is a humble man whose greatest priority is the well being of his family, which he will achieve with the help of this loan.

loans.use: purchase materials to improve his bathroom.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
Salvador is a Guatemalan artisan who specializes in hand-carved wood sculptures and puzzle boxes. He would like to invest in the purchase of more granadillo wood for production.

Salvador has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"My first carving was done with a tree root. I loved discovering images in the natural shape of the wood. I think what I like best about my work is how you can make any kind of figure from an ordinary piece of wood. Images from Maya art are the most difficult to do but they're prettier. It's interesting to work in an area that helps keep our culture alive, the culture of our Maya ancestors and all the animals of our land. Almost all of my carvings are puzzles."

"Dear friends, thank you so much for supporting individual artisans like me, because it's not easy to complete production. Thanks to well-intended people like you who offer microcredits like these, we're able to keep on working and provide for our families, our communities and our countries. Gracias!"

Use the link below to view Salvador's wood sculptures and puzzle boxes on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8237

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of more granadillo wood for production

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Although she received no prior formal education,  Aba  is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling smoked fish in Kufur (near Cape Coast).  She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. Aba  is married and has six  children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.  

Aba  wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of smoked fish. In the long term,  Aba plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of smoked fish.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Araba  is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish paste). She usually sells her ‘banku’ in Kufur  (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘banku’ for 30 years.  

Araba  is married and has two  children. Her husband works as a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.  Araba wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, she will be able to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘banku’. In the long term,  Araba plans to reinvest future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize so as  to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘banku’.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama  is  a widow and has six children. Even though she did not receive any formal education,  Ama is a successful businesswoman.  She sells smoked fish  in Kufur (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for some years now. As the sole breadwinner in the family,  Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family.  Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fresh fish to smoke for sale, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business,  Ama  plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha, is a 45-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and a daughter in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has a business providing passenger transportation services in his auto rickshaw. Her husband has been doing this work for about eight years. To carry out his work, he gets up very early, because he has to look for passengers on the streets of his city.

Ayesha's husband enjoys his work, because he can manage his free time and have more time to spend with his family. In addition, he is able to obtain very good earnings. Now her husband feels tranquil and comfortable, because he has a regular income and has more free time. This will be Ayesha's first loan with Kiva, and she hopes that with Kiva lender's cooperation her husband will be able to carry out his plans. She promises to make his payments on time.

Ayesha requested a loan so that her husband would be able to pay for the body of the auto rickshaw. Ayesha is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan, for this honor.

loans.use: to do  maintenance on their auto rickshaw body.

loans.name: Fredy Oliver

texts.en: A 24-year-old athletic "Iqueña" (from the Ica region), Fredy is a field worker with a high school education. He enjoys playing football and his favorite food is "arroz chaufa" (Peruvian fried rice). In the next six months, Fredy hopes to begin his degree in mechanical engineering, which will put him on track to achieve his lifelong dream: to become a successful professional. With the Kiva loan, Fredy will purchase a closet for his home, which will help improve the quality of his living situation. He is extremely thankful for the support of Kiva lenders and wants them to know that he will put his loan to good use.

loans.use: to purchase a closet for his home

loans.name: Karina Lisseth

texts.es:
Karina es una joven de 25 años de edad,  vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 8 y 5 años ambos del sexo masculino, los cuales estudian en la escuela pública del caserío, el compañero de vida es agricultor en pequeño.
