Ella se dedica a prestar sus servicios como domestica en la ciudad, actividad que desempeña desde hace ya más de 5 años, se desplaza en bus, recorre la distancia de 35km, con un tiempo estimado de 45 min. El horario es accesible para las demás actividades que realiza, porque además de ese trabajo, realiza actividades de agricultura como tapiscar y la limpia de terrenos.

El crédito lo solicita para comprar lo faltante de pesticidas, abono y pagar lo restante a un mozo que trabaja para ella y concluir la siembra de 14, 000 metros cuadrados de maíz que tienen en proceso. 

El crédito podrá garantizar la alimentación para su familia y con la venta de los excedentes podrá tener ingresos que le permitan garantizarles el estudio a sus hijos.  


Su sueño con ver a sus hijos, como unos profesionales, además desea remodelar parte de su vivienda en un futuro.
texts.en:
Karina is 25 years old, and she lives with her long-term partner and their two sons aged 8 and 5 years old. Both children attend the village school, and Karina's husband is a small-scale farmer.

Karina works primarily as a household servant in the nearby town, and has for over five years now. She takes the bus more than 35km (45 minutes) into town. This schedule means that she is available for the other work she does. In addition to her main job, she also does various jobs on the farm, including working the harvest and clearing the fields.

The loan that she is requesting will be for purchasing the remaining pesticides and fertilizer that she needs and also for paying a boy who works for her in order to finish the harvest of their 3.5 acres of corn that are ready.

The loan will ensure that she and her family remain fed and with the income from the sale of the extra, they will be able to continue to send their children to school.

Karina dreams of seeing her sons become professionals, and would also like to remodel part of her home in the future.

loans.use: purchase materials and labor to complete her corn harvest.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Esperanza está en su ciclo número 8vo del programa de comité, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y gracias al esfuerzo que cada una está haciendo todas están mejorando en su nivel de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lucila quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo está mejorando gratamente sus ingresos y está muy contenta con ello. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, y comenta que ya se hizo de muy buena clientela, ya que siempre tiene muy buen producto que ofrecer. Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de jeans, camisas, pantalones y demás para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The "La Esperanza" (Hope) group is in their eighth loan cycle with the program. They are working toward the goal of eliminating poverty, and thanks to the efforts of each one, everybody is improving their own poverty level.

One of the members is Ms. Lucila, who through her continuous hard work is nicely improving her income, which makes her very happy. Her main line of work is selling all sorts of clothing, and she says that she has established a very nice customer base since she always has a lot of good options to offer them.  The credit she is asking for today will be used to purchase jeans, shirts, pants, and other types of clothing so that she can continue her sales as she has been.

loans.use: purchase jeans, shirts, pants, and more.

loans.name: Gull Bibi

texts.en:
Gull bibi belongs to a religious family; in her family the ladies do not do any outside job. The men in her family are all working in the same business selling caps, gloves and goggles near historical places in Lahore city.  She requested a loan for her elder son who wants to buy more inventory to sell. Her elder son has reached the age of marriage, and she wants to do some savings to arrange the marriage ceremony of her elder son.

Her whole family lives in a very congested area and there are no separate rooms for a single family. She wants to construct a new room for her elder son.  She hopes that she will get sufficient savings for the construction.

Gull bibi is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy caps, gloves and goggles to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 43 years old, unmarried, and lives in Nimba County in Liberia.  Nimba is one of the most resource-rich areas in Liberia, producing minerals such as iron ore.  The county shares a border with both Cote D’Ivoire and Guinea.  As a result, many people on business pass through the area bringing lots of trade.  It is also the second more populous area in Liberia.
 
Margaret has a shop which has been selling tea and cold water for the past two years.  She works at her business spending 9 hours.  She transports her goods to her business by bus. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is too little merchandise in her shop.  

Margaret went to school and finished grade 12.  Her fiancee is working with youth and sports.  She has five children between 8 and 27 years old. Only two live at home and attend school. 

With the proceeds from the loan she wants to buy more Lipton's tea and water by the sack.  She describes herself as a hardworking woman.  She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house.  She is proud of her business because she gets money every day for her expenses.
  
Margaret wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more Lipton's tea and drinking water in bags.

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Kou is a 35-year-old business woman from Liberia.  She is single and has six children, between the ages of 2 and 20.  She describes herself as hard-working.

Kou lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire.  Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region.  It also has the second highest population in Liberia. 

Kou has a shop selling flour, oil, sugar, soap, etc. for the past four years.  She works 10 hours at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is that she has a small amount of capital. She intends to use the loan to buy more flour, oil, sugar, soap, etc. for her business. She started her business with money from her mother.  She likes her business because it keeps her busy.  She hopes one day to buy a car.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more flour, oil, sugar, soap, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 28-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children and equally responsible for all of them. She belongs to an ultra poor family, that is why she cannot afford the educational expenses of all her children. 

One of her sons goes with his father to help him in his business. Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he provides welding services. He also provides door to door services to his customers. Due to the increase in the price of iron, he is unable to buy sufficient welding materials such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc. to carry on his business.

To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise he needs some capital to buy welding material.  Kalsoom requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he would be able to buy material to carry on his business. 

Kalsoom is very glad and thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy welding rods, soldering rods, and iron pieces for manufacturing.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Akou, âgée de 38 ans et mère de quatre enfants, vit dans le quartier de Bè, à Lomé. Elle est la seule personne ayant une source de revenu dans son foyer. Entre 1993 et 2008, elle vend des chaussures et des crèmes pour la peau. 
Mais elle abandonne cette  activité suite à la maladie et au décès de son père, et compte tenu de son déménagement dans un nouveau quartier. 
Depuis 2008, elle fait le commerce de beignets et de brochettes de soja. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter un sac de soja et accroître ses revenus.
texts.en:
Akou, aged 38 and the mother of four children, lives in the  Bè district in Lomé. She is the only bread-winner in her household. From 1993 to 2008, she sold shoes and skin cremes. 

However, she abandoned this activity because of the illness and subsequent death of her father, and in view of the fact that they moved to a new district. Since 2008 she has been selling fried doughnuts and  dumplings roasted on a spit, made of soybeans. She is requesting this loan to buy a sack of soybeans and thus increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a tin of vegetable oil and a sack of soybeans.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Maame is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste). She usually sells her ‘Banku’ in Kufur (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ for 15 years.  Maame is married and has three children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Maame wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Banku’. In the long term, Maame plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and maize to make banku to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is an old client, single and residing in rural Nyamitanga, Mbarara District, dealing in a retail shop. She is facing a challenge of low sales during this season. However she has applied for UGX 3,000,000 to complete payment of the land and carry on agriculture to expand her incomes. She is excited about the partnership with Kiva and is confident her dreams will soon come true. In the photo is Ruth (right) and the Ugafode credit officer at the land she wants to buy.

loans.use: To acquire a piece of land for farming

loans.name: Ekyina

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Ekyina did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ekyina sells smoked fish in Kufur (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for some years now. She is married to a maison, and together they have six children. Ekyina uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Ekyina will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of fresh fish to smoke for sale, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ekyina wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet, a repeat client from Ntungamo town with 3 children operates a hotel. She faces a problem of school fees for her children which she has always failed to fund in time since her income is low. She has applied for UGX 300,000 to pay school fees and pay using income from the hotel.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her children.

loans.name: Gawdensia

texts.en: Gawdensia is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as experienced. She sells fish to earn a living. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a freezer to store fish from her fish farm and a water tank to store clean water. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her seventh loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans of KES 100,000 were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to store fish and a water tank

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 51 years old and the mother of five children. Her husband owns an electrician shop in which he sells electrical products and provides repair services. He binds the motors coils of washing machines, water pumps and ceiling fans.  For this purpose, he requires a lot of copper cable coils, which are very expensive and out of his purchasing power.

Therefore, Farida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can be empowered to buy copper coils to carry on his services. In addition, he wants to buy some extra electric switches, bulbs, bulb holders, sockets etc.

This is the first loan for Farida. She wishes to take a huge loan next time.

loans.use: To buy electric wires, cables, bulbs, switches, and coils to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, a new client, is married to Kamadi and is from the rural Ntungamo district. 

Fatuma does cattle fattening, however, she has applied for a loan of ugx.1,000,000 to help cultivate land and improve on agriculture. 

She is hard working and resilient, and thanks Kiva for the partnership.

loans.use: To hire labour to cultivate land

loans.name: Issabela

texts.en: Issabela is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as committed. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a solar panel, solar battery, cables, bulbs and other items for solar installation in their house . They will be able to have lighting in their house and earn some income from charging local residents' mobile phones using the solar energy. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to connect electricity to her home. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a solar panel, solar battery, cables, bulbs and other items

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 31-year-old married man. He has 2 children ages 2 and 8 years. He describes himself as disciplined and enthusiastic. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy cement, sand and other construction materials to construct a base area for a water tank installation. The water tank to be installed will enable them store and access clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will be comfortable. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and other construction materials

loans.name: Karemih

texts.en:
Karemih is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the Kiva profile picture in her sewing workshop. 

Karemih is a 47-year-old from Qalqilia. She is a mother to six sons; two of them are workers. For the past year, Karemih has been working in a sewing workshop she owns. It is a profitable project and provides the family a good income. Karemih would like to improve her workshop. 

Karemih took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy two sewing machines. This will enable her to increase her productivity and also her income will be increased.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines for her sewing workshop

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Sr. Félix es un cliente nuevo de fundación, está acompañado, y comenta que tiene una hija, por quien ambos están luchando y trabajando por darle todo lo que ella necesita para una vida sin privaciones.
El cliente es propietario de una carnicería ya hace más de 20 años, es un señor muy trabajador que con mucho sacrificio ha ido mejorando su negocio, ya que este es el principal sustento de su familia. El está muy agradecido por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo hoy.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de embutidos y carnes, con lo que podrá surtir mayormente su carnicería y seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes.
texts.en: Félix is a new client to the foundation.  He has a common-law wife and says that he has a daughter, for whom they are both striving and working in order to give her what she needs to have a life without hardship.  The borrower has owned a butcher shop for over twenty years already.  He is a hardworking gentleman and he has improved his business through much sacrifice because it is his family’s main support. He is very thankful for the opportunity he is receiving today.  He is requesting the loan to purchase sausage and meat, with which he will be able to mainly stock his butcher shop and continue offering good products to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase meat and sausage.

loans.name: Grecia Dalila

texts.es:
Grecia es una joven de 23 años, estudia administración de empresas, es casada; el esposo trabaja como motorista y han procreado un hijo de 4 años, aún no asiste a la escuela, viven con ella dos hermanos y su mamá, dependen de ella solamente su hijo.

Su negocio es una tienda, tiene 3 años dedicándose a administrarla, lo aprendió de su esposo que la incentivo. Además, de atender la tienda, ella estudia, esta por egresar de la universidad antes solo estudiaba, un hermano le apoya con la tienda y trabaja en casa.
Con el préstamo comprará más mercadería, como: bebidas, golosinas, granos básicos, porqué se  ha quedado un poco corta de inventario. 

Su objetivo es, graduarse y así  trabajar de su carrera y dejar a su hermano en el negocio de la tienda, con las ganancias espera ir ahorrando para su tesis y así también darle lo que necesita a su hijo.
texts.en:
Grecia, 23, studies business administration and is married.  Her husband works as a driver and they have a four-year old son who does not attend school yet.  Her mother and two brothers live with them but her only dependent is her son.

For three years she has been running a store, having learned to manage it from her husband who encouraged her.  Apart from the store she studies at the university and is about to finish.  One of her brothers helps with the store and works at home.

She will use the loan to buy goods such as drinks, sweets and staples in order to replenish her inventory.

Her goal is to graduate and work in her profession.  She will then let her brother run the store.  With her earnings she hopes to save up for her thesis, and also to give her son everything he needs.

loans.use: To buy drinks, sweets, staples to replenish inventory.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as highly motivated. Rose operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, cooking oil, cosmetics, and other items to earn an income.

She will use the KES 26,500 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water that will benefit five family members. The family faces a challenge of lack of funds. 

Rose hopes that in the future, she will live happily. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorbike. He will use the KES 26,500 loan to buy a water tank that will benefit five family members. The family faces the challenge of lack of enough water storage facilities. He hopes that in the future, he will have a healthy family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame  grew up in poverty without an education, yet this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. 

Currently, Maame is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells "Banku" for a living.   (Banku is a traditional Ghanaian dish using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste.)  She primarily sells her banku in Kufur (near Cape Coast). 

Maame has identified growing demand among consumers for her banku. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs because of a limited inventory.  Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more maize and cassava, therefore enablng her to prepare more of her tasty banku. 

Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 10 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their eight children.   With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will have the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize and cassava, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Banku'

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be determined. Josephat operates a herbal medicine business where he sells medicine. 

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a water tank that will benefit nine family members. The family faces a challenge of lack of enough water storage facilities. They will be able to store enough water for domestic use.

He hopes that in the future he will grow economically and sustain his family. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM; the previous loans of KES 120,000 were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en:
Yassah is a 34-year-old business woman from Liberia.  She is married and has four children between 20 and 10; two are in school and live at home.  She describes herself as hard working.

She lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire.  Because of Nimba's status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region.  It also has the second highest population in Liberia. 

Yassh has a table business where she has sold slippers for the past two years.  She works 10 hours at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is too few goods in her shop. She intends to use the loan to buy more slippers for her business. She started her business with money from her mother.  

She likes her business because she makes more profit.  She hopes one day to build a house.  She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Urumkan

texts.ru: Урумкан 52 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей (1 дочь и 1 сын). Образование-средне-специальное. Дети находятся на заработках в России и оказывают финансовую поддержку родителям, высылая им деньги ежемесячно. Супруг активно помогает по хозяйству. В целях основного источника доходов Урумкан с 1993 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 1,500 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход от хозяйства составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Урумкан, на сегодняшний день она имеет в хозяйстве: 2 дойные коровы и 1 лошадь, а также в наличии имеет 0,90 ГА поливной земли, на которой она ежегодно сажает эспарцет и ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Урумкан обратилась в «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы и 1 лошади. Доходы от кредита Урумкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также в будущем намерена купить мебель.
texts.en:
Urumkan is 52 years old, married, and the mother of two children (one daughter and one son).  She has a secondary-specialized education.  Her children both work in Russia and financially support her and her husband, sending them money every month.  Urumkan's husband also actively helps her run her business.

Urumkan has been involved in agriculture, crop farming and animal husbandry, since 1993, providing her family with its main source of income.  Having started in this business with an initial capital of 1,500 som (KGS), she now makes a monthly income of 8,000 som (KGS) from farming.  Thanks to her tireless work, she now owns two dairy cows and a horse and she also uses 0.9 hectares of irrigated land on which she sows sainfoin and barley every year.

In order to further develop her farming business, Urumkan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 135,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy one cow and one horse.  She plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further increasing her livestock headcount.  In the future, she would also like to buy some furniture.

loans.use: to buy one cow and one horse.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Maame is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling second-hand clothes in Kufur (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 11 years. 

Maame is married and has three children.  Her husband works as a corn mill operator. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.  

Maame will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of second-hand clothes, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the type of products she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of second-hand clothes, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is divorced and has five children.  As the sole breadwinner in the family, Theresa uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Even though she did not receive any formal education, Theresa is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells "Banku" for a living. (Banku is a traditional Ghanaian dish using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste.) She normally sells her banku in Kufur (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about four  years. 

Theresa will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to further diversify the type of products she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a 3000 litre water tank

loans.name: Maria Felipa

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con sus hijos en una comunidad de Choluteca, al sur de Honduras, su negocio es la venta de tortillas y tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad.
Doña María el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de maíz, leña y cal para seguir elaborando sus productos, espera que sus ventas aumenten al tener mas productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes que le vistan a diario.
Doña María espera cubrir las necesidades que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga creciendo y se convierta en uno de los negocios más grandes y reconocidos de la zona para poder ayudar a sus hijos a seguir estudiando y que se conviertan en personas de bien con mejores oportunidades en la vida.

Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto 2013
texts.en:
María is a responsible, hard-working, honest person who lives with her children in the community of Choluteca in southern Honduras.  She sells tortillas for a living and has been in business for several years.

María is in need of a loan to buy corn, firewood and limewater to continue making her products.  She wants to increase sales by offering more products to her customers who visit her daily.

María hopes to meet her needs and improve her family's lifestyle.  In a few years she hopes to expand her business and turn it into one of the largest, well-known businesses in the area so she can help her children get ahead, giving them more opportunities in life so they can be good people.


Choluteca, Honduras - August, 2013

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood and limewater for her business.

loans.name: Phaminas

texts.en: Phaminas is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as determined. He will use the KES 26,500 loan to buy a water tank and a gas cooker that will benefit three family members. The tank will enable them to store and access clean water. The family faces a challenge of lack of enough water storage facilities. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and a gas cooker

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario tiene 28 años de edad,  es bachiller, esta acompañado, su compañera de vida no trabaja se dedica a oficios domésticos y al cuido de sus  tres hijos, dos de ellos estudian el otro está de edad prematura, solo él y su familia viven en casa por lo que son dependientes uno del otro.

Él es empleado en un agro servicio desde hace tres años, inicia su jornada laboral a las 7:00 a.m. y sale a las 5:00 P.m..  A la vez, cultiva la tierra, siembra maíz; esto es un ingreso adicional para la familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abonos, pesticidas y prepara la tierra para el cuidado de 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz del cultivo.

Él espera tener mucha producción y conservar maíz para todo el año. Que le genere un ingreso extra para ahorrar y pagar unas deudas que tiene y darle lo mejor a sus hijos que son quienes más lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Mario is 28 years old and is a high school graduate.  His spouse does not work; she does all the household chores and cares for their three children.  Two of their children study and the other is an infant.  Only he and his family live in the house and therefore they are dependent on each other.

He has been employed for three years in farmland services.  He begins his work day at 7:00 a.m. and leaves at 5:00p.m. At the same time, he cultivates the land and sows corn; this is an extra deposit for the family.

The loan that he is asking Fundación Campo is to buy fertilizers, pesticides and to prepare the land to care for 7,000 square meters of corn harvest.

He hopes to have a lot of production and conserve the corn all year.  He hopes to generate extra deposits to save and pay off debts  that he has and give the best to his children who need it the most.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and to prepare the land to care for 7,000 square meters of corn harvest.

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en: Saidat is a new client from rural Ruhaama, Ntungamo District.   She is married to Nazil, a tailor, and they have four children.  Saidat wants to buy school materials to help support her children's education, since her husband's income is inadequate. She is innovative and supportive.

loans.use: To buy school materials for her children

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 51-year-old married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself as determined to succeed. She operates a fish business where she sells fish to earn a living. She will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy a 3000 litre water tank that will benefit 8 people. The family faces a challenge of water shortage. They will be able to store and access clean water for domestic use. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a 3000 litre water tank

loans.name: Lugmon

texts.ru: Лугмон живет с женой и детьми в районе Шахритус. Ему 48 лет. Он занимается растениеводством. Эту профессию он получил от отца. По сей день Лугмон продолжает свою деятельность и в этом ему помогают его дети. У Лугмона большой опыт в сфере земледелия, более 10 лет. Он хочет продолжить свою деятельность и передать свой опыт своим детям. Он берет кредит для покупки  минеральных удобрений для усовершенствования своего урожая. Лугмон на двух гектаре земельного участка посеял пшеницу и теперь ему необходимо провести обработку земли, чтобы получить качественный урожай пшеницы.
texts.en:
Lugmon, age 48, lives with his wife and children in the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan.  He is involved in agriculture, an occupation he learned from his father and that he is still pursuing, with the help of his children.  He has more than ten years of experience and wants to continue working in agriculture, transmitting his experience to his children.

Lugmon is taking a loan to buy mineral fertilizers which will help him to get a better harvest.  He has sown wheat on two hectares of land and he now needs to fertilize his land in order to get a wheat harvest of good quality.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers to grow wheat.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 47-year-old married woman. She has 6 children. She operates a cereals stall where she sells beans, green grams and other cereals. She will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy a 3000 litre water tank that will benefit 10 people. The family faces a challenge of water shortage. They will be able to store and access clean water. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a 3000 litre water tank

loans.name: Maria Sonia

texts.es: Doña Sonia es habitante  de la comunidad de las nubes # 2  ella habita en esta comunidad desde hace 2 años  con sus dos hijos una nieta y su esposo. Uno de sus hijos esta en tercer grado de primaria y  va a la escuela de la comunidad  donde no hay energia electrica . Sonia y su esposo trabajan en una finca cafetalera de la comunidad en la temporada de cosecha ademas tambien se dedican  a la compra y destace de cerdos en los fines de semana esto les permite poder recibir  mas ingresos para el hogar ya que su deseo como padres de familia es poder darles lo mejor a sus hijos. Es por eso que necesitan se les de este credito de un pequeño sstema solar , ya que actualmente ellos se iluminan por las noches con candelas o hacen fogatas con leña en el patio de la casa lo que causa mucho humo contaminan el ambiente ademas de ser peligroso por los niños.
texts.en:
Sonia lives in a community called Nubes #2 where she has been living for two years with he two children, husband and a granddaughter.  One of her children is in third grade at the community school where there is no electricity.  Sonia and her husband work on a coffee plantation during the harvest season.  They also work as pork butchers on the weekend which gives them extra income for the household. 

As parents, they want the best for their children and are requesting a loan to buy a small solar energy system.  Currently, they use candles or fires to light the house at night but the fire in the patio produces a lot of smoke which pollutes the air and is dangerous to the children.

loans.use: To buy equipment for home energy.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Alberto tiene 44 años de edad, es casado  tiene    2 hijos aún pequeños. El está luchando junto a su esposa por sus hijos, ya que quiere darles todo lo que necesitan para poder salir tener una buena vida, educación y vestimenta.
Comenta que para empezar con su negocio recibió ayuda de sus padres gracias a ello pudo comprar algunos productos, gracias al trabajo arduo y a la amabilidad pudo formar su clientela propia. Hoy en día es la única despensa en el lugar y tiene bastantes clientes que siempre van hasta su negocio.
El préstamo solicitado será destinado para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, carnes, verduras y demás, con lo que podrá seguir con sus ventas y generando los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Alberto is 44 years old, married, and has two children that are still small.  Together, he and his wife are striving for their children because they want to give them all they need to be able to have a good life, education, and clothing.  He says that in order to begin his business, he received help from his parents.  Thanks to their support, he was able to buy some products and thanks to hard work and kindness he was able to establish his own customers.  Today, it is the only pantry in the area and he has many customers that always come to his business.  The requested loan will be used to purchase groceries, beverages, meat, vegetables, and other items, which he will be able to continue selling to generate income to help his family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, beverages, meat, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres son las que forman este grupo, como su nombre lo dice, son "Mujeres Alegres" que también trabajan duro para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del esfuerzo que cada una hace. Sara es una de estas mujeres, quien se dedica a la olería, tiene su fabrica de ladrillos, donde invierte su trabajo, tiempo y capital.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que ha demostrado que quiere salir adelante por el esfuerzo que esta haciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de arcilla y de leñas para poder seguir con su oleria y de esa forma tener los ingresos para poder seguir ayudando a su familia. Agradecen todas las integrantes por esta oportunidad que estan recibiendo.
texts.en:
The 15 women who make up this group are as the name says "Mujeres Alegres"  (happy women) who also work hard to help their families through the efforts that each one makes. 

Sara is one of these women. She makes bricks. She has her own brick factory where she invests her time, money and labor. She is a hard-working woman who has demonstrated that she can get ahead by way of her own effort.

Sara is requesting this loan to buy clay and wood so she can continue with her brick-making and have the revenue she needs to support her family. All the members are grateful for this opportunity they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy clay and wood for brick-making.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline, a married mother of four, describes herself to be outgoing. She operates a stall where she sells fish. 


Pauline has requested her first loan with SMEP DTM for KES 21,000 to buy a 3000 litre water tank that will benefit 10 people. The family faces a challenge of water shortage, so this will enable them to store and access clean water for domestic use.

loans.use: buy a 3000 litre tank

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 58 años de edad, no tiene ningún grado académico, es viuda, tiene  4 hijos, solamente dos viven con ella, y solo uno de ellos trabaja, el otro pasa en la casa, su madre y su hermano también viven con ella.

Cuenta con 5 años de criar y comercializar ganado, lo aprendió de su difundo esposo, que se dedicaba a lo mismo. También, cultiva maíz, antes vendía licores naturales, trabaja en casa y solo se desplaza en la mañana a las 5 de la madrugada, y regresa a las 3 de la tarde a traer y dejar los animales.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar  dos vacas que serán para la producción de leche, con esto espera elaborar queso y venderlo en la comunidad y así tener también una fuente de alimento más en la casa.

Ella quiere tener muchas vacas en producción de leche y así  dedicarse a la venta de lácteos y  siempre una fuente de ingreso en su hogar.
texts.en:
Blanca, 58, does not have an education.  She is a widow and has four children, but only two live with her.  One of them works and the other stays at home.  Her mother and brother also live with her.

For five years she has been raising and selling cattle.  She learned the trade from her late husband who was in the same business.  She also grows corn and used to sell natural liquors.  She works at home and goes off in the morning at 5:00 a.m., returning at 3:00 p.m., bringing the cattle.

The loan she is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy two dairy cows to make cheese and sell it in her community.  This will give her extra income at home.

She wants to have many dairy cows so she can sell dairy products and always have an income for the household.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel es casado con la señora Susana hace varios años, el es taxista y ella vende ropas. Este es el segundo crédito del Sr. Miguel con Kiva, y agradece porque gracias al anterior pudo ayudar a su esposa en su negocio, hoy solicita de este este crédito para poder reparar la chapearía y pintura de su taxi, para que así pueda seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Agradece por la ayuda que esta recibiendo.
texts.en: Miguel has been married to Susan for a number of years. He is a taxi driver and she sells clothes. This is Miguel's second loan with Kiva and he is grateful as he was able to help his wife in her business with the last loan. He is requesting this loan to fix the bodywork and paint his taxi, so he can continue to provide good service to his customers. He is thankful for the help he is receiving.

loans.use: to do bodywork and paint his taxi

loans.name: Josesh Farid

texts.en: Josesh, a 30-year-old security guard, lives with his family in his hometown of Imperial. When he is not working, he enjoys playing soccer on the weekends with friends, including his best friend with whom he also works. Josesh successfully completed his high school degree, but was unable to start a post-secondary education in his preferred field, administration. Thanks to the effort put forth by his parents, in combination with Josesh's financial contributions, he was able to finish building most of his house. Josesh is grateful to Kiva lenders, with whose support he will be able to finish plastering the outside of his home.

loans.use: to pay for materials to plaster the facade of his home
